sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5292 (S18W63) PRODUCED NUMEROUS FLARES WITH THE MOST ENERGETIC AN M1/0F WITH TYPE II AT 0625Z. OCCASIONAL MID-C CLASS ACTIVITY ALSO OCCURRED IN REGIONS 5290 (N22W72) AND 5303 (S18W18). NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 5304 (N22E69) ROTATED FULLY INTO VIEW. SURGING WAS NOTED AT VARIOUS LATITUDES ON THE NE LIMB.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGIONS 5290, 5292, AND TO A LESSER DEGREE, 5303, MAY YIELD ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY AT SOME POINT DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 31/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS, PROBABLY DUE TO THE FLARE ACTIVITY OF 30 DEC. QUIET TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS SHOULD END THE INTERVAL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY CONTINUES MODERATE. A LONG- DURATION M2 TENFLARE REACHED MAXIMUM AT 1910Z AND IS STILL WELL ABOVE BACKGROUND.  EARLY REPORTS SUGGEST THE FLARE ORIGINATED AT THE NORTHWEST LIMB WHERE LOOPS WERE SEEN IN THE VICINITY OF REGION 5290 (N23W82). ANOTHER M-CLASS EVENT - AN M1/0F - WAS OBSERVED IN REGION 5292 (S17W76) AT 1036Z. NEW REGION 5305 (N10E68) BECAME VISIBLE NEAR EAST LIMB AND THERE MAY BE TWO MORE AS YET UNNUMBERED REGIONS ALSO COMING ON THE DISK NEARBY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO REMAIN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. FOUR M-CLASS FLARES OCCURRED: AN UNOBSERVED M1 AT 1023Z; AN M1/0F FROM REGION 5303 (S18W45) AT 1149Z; AN M1/0F FROM REGION 5297 (S15W60) AT 1350Z; AND AN M1/0F FROM REGION 5307 (N26E63) AT 1738Z. NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 5308 (S11W24) WAS BORN ON THE DISK. SURGING WAS REPORTED AT WEST LIMB NEAR N22 AND S20, AND AT EAST LIMB NEAR S20.

sections.text: REMAIN MODERATE. ADDITIONAL M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED FROM REGIONS 5303 AND 5307.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY REMAINS AT A MODERATE LEVEL. REGION 5303 (S18W60) PRODUCED MOST OF THE DAY'S FLARES WITH ITS LARGEST A LONG-DURATION M4/1N TENFLARE AT 1805Z. RADIO BURSTS OF MODERATE SIZE WERE RECORDED ACROSS THE SPECTRUM IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE EVENT. THE REGION POSSESSES A SLIGHT DEGREE OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. OTHER DISK REGIONS WERE STABLE OR DECAYING FOR THE MOST PART. SURGING CONTINUED AT NW20 AND WAS ALSO SEEN NEAR SE30.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5303 SHOWS NO SIGNS OF ABATING ITS FLARE ACTIVITY. ALSO WATCH EAST LIMB FOR THE IMMINENT RETURN OF OLD REGION 5273 (S30, L=323) WHICH PRODUCED X-CLASS ACTIVITY ON 18 DEC.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 03/2100Z TO 04/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET. TWO SMALL SUDDEN IMPULSES OCCURRED AT 0850 AND 1856Z. BOTH MEASURED ABOUT 10 NANOTESLAS AT BOULDER.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 04/2100Z
sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5303 (S18W72) PRODUCED BUT TWO C-CLASS SUBFLARES SINCE YESTERDAY'S M4/1N PROTON FLARE. CALCIUM XV (YELLOW LINE) EMISSION WAS OBSERVED NEAR S30 AT EAST LIMB BUT AS YET JUST SPOTLESS PLAGE HAS ROTATED ONTO THE DISK. NEAR CONTINUOUS SURGING WAS SEEN IN THAT VICINITY, AND IT WAS ALSO REPORTED NEAR NE30.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5303 STILL APPEARS TO BE A GOOD CANDIDATE FOR M-CLASS ACTIVITY AND THE REGION ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB MAY ALSO PARTICIPATE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 04/2100Z TO 05/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. A SMALL GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT, PROBABLY SPAWNED BY THE M4/1N TENFLARE AT 04/1805Z IN REGION 5303, BEGAN AT 04/2305Z, REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 28 PFU AT 05/0130Z, AND ENDED AT 05/0905Z. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 37 NANOTESLAS AT BOULDER WAS DETECTED AT 04/2307Z, JUST PRIOR TO THE BULK OF THE PROTONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE THE NEXT 24 HOURS AS THE FLARE-RELATED DISTURBANCE WEAKENS. UNSETTLED CONDITIONS ARE THEN LIKELY TO PREVAIL THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. NEW REGION 5312 (S30E72) ROTATED INTO VIEW AND PRODUCED AN M8/1N FLARE AT 1805Z WITH A WEAK TYPE II RADIO SWEEP. THE REGION PRODUCED STRONG SURGING AND CORONAL LINE EMISSION THROUGHOUT THE DAY AND APPEARS TO BE A LARGE COMPLICATED GROUP WITH STRONG MAGNETIC FIELDS. ITS LOCATION CORRESPONDS WELL WITH OLD REGION 5273 WHICH PRODUCED SEVERAL M-CLASS FLARES AND AN X-CLASS FLARE ON ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT. ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES OCCURRED: AN M1 AT 0508Z WHICH WAS NOT OBSERVED OPTICALLY, AND AN M1/SN FROM REGION 5301 (S18W68) AT 1925Z. THE SOLAR DISK CURRENTLY HAS SEVEN MATURE  GROUPS  WHICH  HAVE  ALL  EXHIBITED  BRIGHT  PLAGE FLUCTUATIONS THROUGHOUT THE LATTER PART OF THE DAY. THIS HAS BEEN EVIDENT IN THE ENHANCEMENT OF THE X-RAY BACKGROUND LEVELS ABOVE C4 SINCE ABOUT 1500Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 5301 (S18W68), 5303 (S19W83), 5305 (N11E16),  5307 (N28E27),  5309 (S18E43) ARE SUFFICIENTLY DEVELOPED THAT EACH OF THEM POSES A SLIGHT THREAT FOR M-CLASS FLARES. REGION 5312 (S30E72) IS EXPECTED TO BE THE MAIN SOURCE OF ACTIVITY OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS AND WILL PROBABLY PRODUCE ADDITIONAL CLASS M5 OR GREATER FLARES DURING ITS TRANSIT OF THE DISK. OLD REGION 5278 (N28, L=275), WHICH PRODUCED TWO X-CLASS FLARES ON ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT IS DUE TO RETURN ON 08-09 JANUARY AND IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE SOLAR ACTIVITY AND BACKGROUND LEVELS AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 05/2100Z TO 06/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE PREDOMINATELY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 06/2100Z
sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5312 (S31E64) PRODUCED TODAY'S LARGEST EVENT, AN X1/1F FLARE AT 0430Z. A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION HAS ROTATED INTO VIEW IN THE TRAILING PORTION OF THE REGION. ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES OCCURRED DURING THE PERIOD: AN M1 AT 2343Z, THREE M1/SF FLARES FROM REGION 5301 (S18W81) AT 1309Z, 1721Z, AND 1813Z, AND TWO M1/SF FLARES FROM REGION 5312 AT 1849Z AND 1945Z. THE 10CM FLUX ROSE DRAMATICALLY TO 248 SFU TODAY, AND THE X-RAY FLUXES HAVE BEEN ENHANCED ABOVE C3 LEVEL SINCE 06/2100Z AND ABOVE C6 LEVEL SINCE ABOUT 07/1200Z. SURGING WAS OBSERVED ON THE WEST LIMB ASSOCIATED WITH THE EXIT OF REGIONS 5301 AND 5303 FROM THE SOLAR DISK. CORONAGRAPH OBSERVATIONS INDICATE THAT CORONAL MASS EJECTIONS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH YESTERDAY'S M8 FLARE AND TODAY'S X1 FLARE BOTH OF WHICH WERE PRODUCED BY REGION 5312.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 5312 IS EXPECTED TO BE THE MAIN SOURCE OF ACTIVITY OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS AND CONTINUES TO POSE A SLIGHT THREAT FOR X-CLASS OR PROTON PRODUCING FLARES. REGIONS 5301, 5307 (N30E14) AND 5309 (S18E29) ARE ALSO CAPABLE OF KEEP- ING ACTIVITY AT MODERATE LEVELS. OLD REGION 5278 (N28, L-275) IS DUE TO RETURN LATE TOMORROW AND MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO SOLAR ACTIVITY AND BACKGROUND LEVELS WHEN IT APPEARS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 06/2100Z TO 07/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT PREDOMINATELY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS OBSERVED AT APPROXIMATELY 2355Z ON 06 JANUARY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO INCREASE TO GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS IN RESPONSE TO THE CORONAL MASS EJECTION/SOLAR FLARE ACTIVITY OF THE LAST TWO DAYS. HIGH LATITUDES MAY EXPERIENCE BRIEF MINOR STORM PERIODS ON THE SECOND DAY DURING THE PEAK OF THE DISTURBANCE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5312 (S31E53) PRODUCED AN M7/1B FLARE AT 1253Z WITH PARALLEL RIBBONS, SEVERAL ERUPTIVE CENTERS AND MODERATE SIZED DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. THE GROUP IS MAGNETICALLY COMPLICATED WITH STRONG FIELDS AND GRADIENTS IN A DELTA CONFIGURATION, AND HAS SHOWN CONTINUED GROWTH DURING THE PERIOD. AN M5 FLARE OCCURRED AT 1717Z WITHOUT ANY SIGNATURE IN OPTICAL WAVELENGTHS, SUGGESTING THAT AN EVENT OCCURRED BEHIND ONE OF THE SOLAR LIMBS. REGION 5311 (S14E33) GREW SIGNIFICANTLY AND APPEARED TO HAVE EVOLVED TO A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION BY THE END OF THE PERIOD. THE EAST LIMB WAS ACTIVE TODAY: CORONAGRAPH OBSERVATIONS INDICATE SEVERAL CORONAL MASS EJECTIONS OCCURRED IN THE LAST 24 HOURS; PROMINENCE ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED AT S30, N20, AND N32, AND SURGE ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED AT ABOUT N30. EXITING REGION 5301 (S18W92) ALSO PRODUCED STRONG SURGING DURING THE DAY WHICH WAS PARTICULARLY BRIGHT FROM 0219-0520Z. ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES OBSERVED FOR THE PERIOD WERE AN M1 AT 2257Z, AN M2 AT 0654Z, AN M1/SF FROM 5310 (S25E10) AT 1509Z, AN M1/SF FROM 5312 AT 1908Z, AN M1/SF FROM 5311 AT 1910Z, AND AN M1 AT 1955Z. THE SOLAR BACKGROUND LEVELS WERE ELEVATED THROUGHOUT THE DAY WITH THE 10CM FLUX AT 268 SFU AND THE X-RAY BACKGROUND AT APPROXIMATELY C6.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. REGION 5312 IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AS THE MAIN SOURCE OF ACTIVITY OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS AND WILL PROBABLY PRODUCE ADDITIONAL CLASS M5 OR GREATER FLARES. REGION 5311 IS EXPECTED TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE M-CLASS FLARE ACTIVITY AND OLD REGION 5278 (N28, L-275), WHICH IS EXPECTED TO RETURN SHORTLY SHOULD ALSO RAISE ACTIVITY AND BACKGROUND LEVELS WHEN IT APPEARS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET UNTIL ABOUT 1200Z WHEN CONDITIONS BECAME GENERALLY ACTIVE WITH SOME MINOR STORM PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE DISTURBANCE MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY THE CORONAL MASS EJECTION/SOLAR FLARE ACTIVITY WHICH OCCURRED LATE ON THE 6TH AND EARLY ON THE 7TH OR BY A CORONAL HOLE WHICH WAS OBSERVED TODAY AT N27E35.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE WITH OCCASIONAL MINOR STORM PERIODS AT HIGHER LATITUDES FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS AS THE CURRENT ACTIVITY PERSISTS. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO GRADUALLY SUBSIDE TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5312 (S31E42) DOMINATED SOLAR ACTIVITY WITH CONTINUED GROWTH, MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY AND FLARE PRODUCTION. THE REGION PRODUCED THE DAY'S LARGEST EVENT, AN M8/1B FLARE AT 1926Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A TENFLARE AND FLARE LOOPS. THE REGION PRODUCED TWO ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES: AN M4/SN AT 2348Z AND AN M2/SN AT 0509Z. REGION 5311 (S14E18) ALSO EXHIBITED GROWTH AND BRIGHT PLAGE FOR MOST OF THE DAY WITH A WEAK DELTA CONFIGURATION IN THE TRAILER AREA AND PRODUCED AN M2/SF AT 0715Z. THE REGION APPEARED TO BE WEAK- ENING NEAR THE END OF THE DAY. ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES FOLLOW: AN M3/2N FROM SPOTLESS REGION 5315 (N29E04), AN M1/SF FROM THE SURGE REGION ON THE EAST LIMB AT N19, AND AN UNASSOCIATED M1 AT 1409Z. X-RAY FLUX LEVELS AND 10CM FLUX CONTINUE TO BE ELEVATED ALTHOUGH NOT AS HIGH AS YESTERDAY, PROBABLY BECAUSE OF THE EXIT OF REGION 5301 (S18) AROUND THE WEST LIMB. EAST LIMB CORONAL ACTIVITY CONTINUED TO BE IMPRESSIVE AND SURGING CONTINUES AT S34, N20, AND N30. A NEW GROUP 5316 (S32E67) ROTATED INTO VIEW TODAY WHICH WAS PROBABLY RESPONSIBLE FOR THE S34 SURGE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. REGION 5312 IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AS THE MAIN SOURCE OF ACTIVITY OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS AND WILL PROBABLY PRODUCE ADDITIONAL CLASS M5 OR LARGER FLARES. AS THE REGION MOVES ACROSS THE DISK, THE PROBABILITY OF A PROTON PRODUCING FLARE INCREASES. REGION 5311 IS EXPECTED TO CONTRIBUTE TO M-CLASS FLARE ACTIVITY, AND REGIONS 5305 (N11W25) AND 5307 (N28W11) POSE A SLIGHT THREAT FOR ADDITIONAL M-FLARES AS WELL. BECAUSE OF THE CORONAL ACTIVITY AND SURGE ACTIVITY ON THE EAST LIMB IT IS EXPECTED THAT THE LONGITUDES WHICH ROTATE INTO VIEW OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS WILL ENHANCE SOLAR ACTIVITY AND BACKGROUND LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 08/2100Z TO 09/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. THE DISTURBANCE MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY THE SOLAR FLARE/CORONAL MASS EJECTION ACTIVITY WHICH OCCURRED LATE ON THE 6TH AND EARLY ON THE 7TH OR BY A CORONAL HOLE OBSERVED YESTERDAY TO BE CENTERED AT ABOUT N27W35.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO REMAIN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS IN RESPONSE TO THE RECENT SOLAR FLARE AND CORONAL MASS EJECTION ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 09/2100Z
sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5312 (S31E28) CONTINUED TO DOMINATE THE SOLAR DISK AND PRODUCED THE DAY'S LARGEST EVENT, AN X1/1B FLARE WHICH OCCURRED AT 2031Z AND WAS ACCOMPANIED BY OUTSTANDING DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS WITH A CASTELLI-U SIGNATURE AND BY A MODERATE TYPE II RADIO SWEEP WITH ESTIMATED SHOCK VELOCITY AT 1000 KM/S. THIS REGION CONTINUES TO GROW IN AREA WITH ITS FKC BETA-GAMMA-DELTA CLASSIFICATION, EXHIBITING STRONG MAGNETIC FIELDS AND GRADIENTS. THE REGION PRODUCED ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES DURING THE PERIOD: AN M3/1N AT 0034Z, AN M3/SN AT 0628Z, AND AN M2/SN AT 1759Z. ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES OCCURRED: M1/1F FROM REGION 5316 (S32E56), AN UNASSOCIATED M1 AT 1312Z, AND AN M1/SF FROM 5315 (N35W03). FOUR NEW REGIONS ROTATED INTO VIEW: 5317 (N20E65), 5318 (N27E68), 5319 (S19E53), AND 5320 (S19E76). SURGING CONTINUED ON THE EAST LIMB AT N20.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. REGION 5312 IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AS THE MAIN SOURCE OF ACTIVITY OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS AND IS LIKELY TO PRODUCE ADDITIONAL CLASS M5 OR LARGER FLARES. THE LIKELIHOOD OF PROTON PRODUCING FLARES WILL INCREASE AS THE REGION MOVES TO MORE WESTERLY LONGITUDES. REGION 5311 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE SOME M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 09/2100Z TO 10/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. SOME BRIEF ACTIVE PERIODS OCCURRED AT HIGHER LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE IN RESPONSE TO THE SOLAR FLARE EFFECTS OF THE PREVIOUS FEW DAYS. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE THAT TODAY'S X-CLASS SOLAR FLARE WILL ENHANCE THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV ENERGETIC PARTICLE FLUXES.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET LEVELS UNTIL 13/1330Z WHEN A SHOCK ARRIVAL WAS OBSERVED AT THE GOES SATELLITE MAGNETOMETERS.  GROUND BASED OBSERVATORIES RECORDED MOSTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS THEREAFTER.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS, REACHING STORM CONDITIONS ON THE SECOND DAY OF THE FORECAST AND DECLINING TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE BY THE THIRD DAY.  PROTONS AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV HAVE NOT YET ARRIVED FROM TODAY'S FLARES, AND THE PROSPECT OF PROTONS FROM THESE FLARES IS BECOMING LESS LIKELY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED M5 X-RAY BURST OCCURRED AT 16/1101Z. REGION 5312 (S32W46) REMAINED MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX WHILE CONTINUING A VERY GRADUAL RATE OF DECAY. THE REGION PRODUCED THREE M-CLASS EVENTS DURING THE PERIOD: AN M1/1N AT 16/0631Z, AN M2/1F AT 16/0921Z (ACCOMPANIED BY A TYPE II SWEEP, ESTIMATED VELOCITY 800 KM/SEC), AND AN M1/SF AT 16/1517Z. REGION 5317 (N22W13) CONTINUED TO GROW, BUT AT A REDUCED RATE. IT PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 5321 (N18E09) PRODUCED AN M1/SF AT 16/0328Z. NO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE FROM REGION 5312. M-CLASS FLARING MAY OCCUR WITHIN REGIONS 5317 AND 5321.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. THIS ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLY IN RESPONSE TO THE X2/2B FLARE THAT OCCURRED ON 14 JANUARY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE LEVELS TOMORROW AS TODAY'S ACTIVITY CONTINUES. THE SECOND DAY SHOULD SEE THE FIELD DECLINE TO UNSETTLED LEVELS. THE FINAL DAY OF THE PERIOD IS EXPECTED TO ACTIVE IN RESPONSE TO THE TYPE II SWEEP MENTIONED ABOVE.

sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5312 (S33W57) REMAINED IN A PERIOD OF GRADUAL DECAY, BUT MAINTAINED ITS COMPLEX MAGNETIC STRUCTURE. THIS REGION WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ONLY M-LEVEL EVENT OF THE PERIOD: AN M7/SB FLARE AT 16/2220Z. THE EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR DISCRETE FREQUENCY RADIO EMISSIONS. sections.text: HIGH. REGION 5312 MAY PRODUCE A MAJOR FLARE DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 5317 (N22W26) HAS THE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TOMORROW. THE SECOND DAY IS EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE DUE TO YESTERDAY'S M2/1F/TYPE II SWEEP EVENT. THE FINAL DAY OF THE PERIOD IS EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED. HIGH LATITUDES MAY EXPERIENCE ACTIVE LEVELS THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD.

sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5312 (S34W69) PRODUCED TWO MAJOR FLARES DURING THE PERIOD. THE FIRST WAS AN X1/1F FLARE AT 18/0718Z ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. THE SECOND WAS AN M9/1N AT 18/0908Z, ALSO ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR DISCRETE BURSTS. SPOTLESS REGION 5318 (N28W32) ALSO PRODUCED A MAJOR FLARE: AN M9/3B AT 18/1826Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A 1500 SFU TENFLARE, OTHER MINOR DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS, AND A TYPE II SWEEP BURST. ANOTHER TYPE II SWEEP OCCURRED EARLIER IN THE DAY AT 18/0026Z. THIS WAS ASSOCIATED WITH AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED C5 X-RAY BURST. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. THE 5317 (N21W41)/5318 COMPLEX APPEARS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING MORE MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. THE SAME IS TRUE OF REGION 5312.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. THE BRUNT OF THE MINOR STORMING IS EXPECTED ON 20 JANUARY IN RESPONSE TO TODAY'S M9/3B FLARE. A PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN NEAR 18/2200Z AND REACH A MAXIMUM FLUX OF 84 P/CM-2/SEC/STER NEAR 19/0100Z. THIS EVENT IS ALSO EXPECTED IN RESPONSE TO TODAY'S M9/3B FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY CONTINUED MODERATE. REGION 5329 (N17W59) WAS TYHE DAY'S MOST PROLIFIC FLARE PRODUCER. ITS MOST ENERGETIC EVENT WAS AN M1/1B WITH TYPE II AT 0354Z. IT ALSO JOINED FORCES WITH REGION 5334 (S20E77) TO YIELD AN M2 (OPTICALLY, REGION 5334 WAS 1B, REGION 5329 WAS 0F) WITH TYPE II AND IV SWEEP AT 0110Z. REGION 5334 INCREASED IN MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY TO A BETA-DELTA CLASSIFICATION. AT WEST LIMB, TYPE II SWEEP ACCOMPANIED THE ERUPTION OF A PROMINENCE NEAR REGION 5324 (N24) AT 0155Z. MATERIAL WAS SEEN OUT TO .36 SOLAR RADII.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5334 (S21E04) PRODUCED THE DAY'S LARGEST EVENT, AN M7/1N FLARE AT 1214Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY SIGNIFICANT RADIO BURSTS AND A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP. THE EVENT WAS COMPLICATED BY SYMPATHETIC, TIME-COINCIDENT FLARING FROM REGION 5330 (S18W36). A SIMILAR NEAR-SIMULTANEOUS EVENT OCCURRED AS AN M1 FLARE AT 1740Z WITH 1N OPTICAL FLARES OBSERVED FROM REGIONS 5334 AND 5329 (N19W69). TWO ADDITIONAL M-FLARES WERE OBSERVED DURING THE DAY: AN M1/1N AT 0127Z AND AN M1/1N AT 0306Z, BOTH OF WHICH WERE PRODUCED BY REGION 5334. REGION 5334 DISPLAYED CONTINUED GROWTH AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY DURING THE PERIOD WHEREAS REGIONS 5329 AND 5330 WERE OBSERVED TO BE DECLINING AND LOSING INTENSITY. THREE NEW REGIONS ROTATED INTO VIEW TODAY AND ONE NEW REGION EMERGED ON THE DISK. PROMINENCE ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED ON THE EAST LIMB AT ABOUT N30.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5334 IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES AND REGIONS 5329 AND 5330 CONTINUE TO POSE A THREAT FOR MODERATE ACTIVITY AS WELL. OLD REGION 5312 (S33, L-300, MAX CLASS/ AREA FKC/1800 ON 15 JAN), WHICH PRODUCED 33 M-CLASS FLARES AND 6 X-CLASS FLARES ON ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT IS DUE TO RETURN ON 03 FEBRUARY AND IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE ACTIVITY AND BACKGROUND FLUX LEVELS SUBSTANTIALLY AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 31/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED UNTIL 0600Z WHEN CONDITIONS BECAME INCREASINGLY ACTIVE. MIDDLE LATITUDES CONTINUED AT ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY AND HIGHER LATITUDES ATTAINED MINOR STORM LEVELS FROM APPROXIMATELY 1500-2100Z. THE DISTURBANCE MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY COMBINED EFFECTS OF THE SOLAR ACTIVITY WHICH OCCURRED ON 30 JANUARY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THROUGH TOMORROW AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE PERSISTS. EFFECTS FROM TODAY'S M7 FLARE MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE SOMEWHAT, BEGINNING LATE TOMORROW AND LASTING PARTWAY THROUGH THE SECOND DAY. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE TO GENERALLY UNSETTLED LEVELS THEREAFTER

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5334 (S21W09) PRODUCED ALL OF TODAY'S M-CLASS FLARES: THE LARGEST WAS AN M3/1N AT 1038Z, WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY SYMPATHETIC SUBFLARING FROM REGION 5329 (N20W81). REGION 5334 SHOWED SIGNS OF DECAY IN PEN- UMBRAL COVERAGE AND SIMPLIFICATION OF ITS MAGNETIC STRUCTURE FROM A DELTA CONFIGURATION TO A BETA-GAMMA CLASSIFICATION. ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES PRODUCED BY THE REGION WERE AN M1/1N AT 2121Z AND AN M1/SN AT 0205Z. A 40 DEGREE FILAMENT CENTERED AT ABOUT N49E20 DISAPPEARED FROM THE SOLAR DISK BETWEEN 0711Z AND 1159Z. A NEW REGION 5344 (N09W49) EMERGED ON THE DISK. SURGE AND LOOP PROMINENCE ACTIVITY WAS VISIBLE ON THE WEST LIMB AT N17 ASSOCIATED WITH THE EXIT OF REGION 5329.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5334 IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES ALTHOUGH THEY ARE EXPECTED TO BE LESS FREQUENT AND LESS INTENSE THAN THE PREVIOUS FEW DAYS. OLD REGION 5312 (S33, L-300 MAX CLASS/AREA FKC/1800 ON 15 JAN), WHICH PRODUCED 33 M-CLASS FLARES AND 6 X-CLASS FLARES ON ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT IS DUE TO RETURN ON 03 FEBRUARY AND IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE ACTIVITY AND BACKGROUND FLUX LEVELS AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 31/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE PERIOD. A PERIOD OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS OCCURRED FROM 1800-2400Z YESTERDAY, AND GEOSTATIONARY MAGNETOMETERS (GOES-6) RECORDED A MAGNETOPAUSE CROSSING JUST BEFORE 31/2200Z. A SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS OBSERVED AT 1030Z AND AN ADDITIONAL PERIOD OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOLLOWED FROM 01/1030-1300Z. THE DISTURBANCE APPEARED TO HAVE SUBSIDED NEAR THE END OF THE DAY. THIS ACTIVITY IS THOUGHT TO HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY THE SOLAR ACTIVITY THAT OCCURRED ON 30-31 JANUARY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR MOST OF TOMMOROW, WITH A FAIR CHANCE FOR ISOLATED SUBSTORMS NEAR LOCAL MIDNIGHT. CONDITIONS SHOULD BE UNSETTLED THEREAFTER UNTIL 04 FEBRUARY WHEN AN INCREASE TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS IS FORECAST DUE TO THE FILAMENT DISAPPEARENCE THAT OCCURRED TODAY.

sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5334 (S21W22) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS FLARE: AN M1/1N AT 1731Z. THE REGION CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE SOLAR DISK BUT IS SLOWLY DECLINING AND SIMPLIFYING. TWO ADDITIONAL TINY NEW REGIONS EMERGED ON THE DISK AND NEW REGION 5347 (N16E73) ROTATED INTO VIEW. OLD REGION 5312 (S33, L-300, MAX CLASS/AREA FKC/1800 ON 15 JAN), WHICH PRODUCED 33 M-CLASS FLARES AND 6 X-CLASS FLARES ON ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT IS DUE TO RETURN TOMORROW AND IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE ACTIVITY AND BACK- GROUND LEVELS AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 01/2100Z TO 02/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED, BUT TWO PERIODS OF SUBSTORMING OCCURRED. THE FIRST ONE WAS FROM 2100-0300Z AND THE SECOND WAS FROM 1800-2100Z. DURING THE SUBSTORMS MIDDLE LATITUDES WERE ACTIVE AND HIGH LATITUDES ATTAINED MINOR STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED TOMORROW AND IS EXPECTED TO BECOME ACTIVE ON 04-05 FEBRUARY WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR PERIODS OF STORM CONDITIONS. THIS FORECAST IS BASED ON THE DISAPPEARANCE OF A LARGE SOLAR FILAMENT ON 01 FEBRUARY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. A LONG DURATION ENHANCEMENT OF THE X-RAY EMISSION OCCURRED FROM 1355-1757Z: THE EVENT HAD A SOMEWHAT GRADUAL RISE, TWO PEAKS (M3 AT 1436Z AND M1 AT 1626Z), AND A SLOW DECLINE. SUBFLARE MAXIMUMS OBSERVED IN THIS TIME WINDOW WERE PRODUCED BY REGION 5336 (S20W93) AT 1416Z AND BY REGION 5330 (N19W80) AT 1545Z, NEITHER OF WHICH CORRESPONDS WELL WITH THE X-RAY MAXIMA. IT SEEMS LIKELY, THERE- FORE, THAT THE SIGNATURE INDICATES A SIGNIFICANT SOLAR EVENT BEHIND THE LIMB. FOUR NEW SUNSPOT GROUPS EMERGED ON THE DISK TODAY AND NEW REGION 5353 (S29E84) ROTATED INTO VIEW AS THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 5312. OBSERVATIONS AT THIS TIME INDICATE 5353 IS A BI-POLAR D-TYPE SUNSPOT GROUP. CORONAL RAIN WAS OBSERVED ON THE EAST LIMB AT N32.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES FOR M-CLASS FLARES ARE CONSIDERED TO BE FROM BEHIND THE EAST LIMB (BECAUSE OF TODAY'S EVENT), REGION 5334 (S21W22) AND REGION 5353 (S29E84).

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 02/2100Z TO 03/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. CONDITIONS WERE INITIALLY ACTIVE BUT INTENSIFIED TO A MINOR STORM AT ABOUT 03/0100Z AND WITH THE EXCEPTION OF A FEW BRIEF ACTIVE PERIODS, REMAINDED AT THAT LEVEL ALL DAY. A MAJOR STORM PERIOD AT HIGH LATITUDES OCCURRED BETWEEN 1200-1800Z. THE DISTURBANCE WAS PROBABLY CAUSED BY THE FILAMENT THAT DISAPPEARED ON 01 JANUARY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THROUGH TOMORROW. MOSTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS IN RESPONSE TO A CORONAL HOLE WHICH WILL BE FAVORABLY POSITIONED AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. NEW REGION 5354 (N30E75) PRODUCED AN X1 FLARE AT 1017Z WITH FAIRLY STRONG DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS, A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP AND A MODERATE TYPE IV SWEEP. THE EVENT ROSE RAPIDLY BUT DECAYED SLOWLY, RESULTING IN A LONG DURA- TION OF 171 MINUTES. OPTICAL OBSERVATORIES REPORTED SPECTACULAR LOOPS ON THE EAST LIMB WHICH WERE VERY BRIGHT DURING THE EVENT AND CONTINUED TO BE VISIBLE THROUGHOUT THE DAY. CORONAL OBSERVA- TIONS BY SMM INDICATED THAT A LARGE, FAST MOVING MASS EJECTION OCCURRED ON THE NORTHEAST LIMB BEGINNING AT 1014Z, JUST BEFORE X-RAY MAXIMUM. REGION 5354 ALSO PRODUCED A C9 FLARE AT 0022Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH SPRAY ACTIVITY OUT TO .16 RADII AND A MODERATE TYPE II SWEEP. REGION 5353 (S30E69) ROTATED MORE FULLY INTO VIEW AS A SMALL, D-TYPE GROUP AND WAS QUIET. REGION 5334 (S22W48) PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARE FLUCTUATIONS BUT CONTINUES TO DECAY. SURGING WAS OBSERVED ON THE WEST LIMB AT S20, ASSOCIATED WITH THE EXIT OF REGION 5336, AND ON THE EAST LIMB AT N30, ASSOCIATED WITH THE ENTRANCE OF REGION 5354.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY ACTIVE WITH SOME ISOLATED PERIODS OF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS. sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE OVER THE NEXT TWO DAYS IN RESPONSE TO A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE. THE DISTRUBANCE IS EXPECTED TO GRADUALLY SUBSIDE BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5368 (S13W24) GENERATED TWO M-CLASS FLARES, AN M2/0B AT 1223Z AND AN M3/1B AT 1822Z. NEITHER FLARE WAS IMPRESSIVE IN THE RADIO SPECTRUM. THE REGION HAS GROWN IN BOTH WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA AND CURRENTLY EXHIBITS A BETA-GAMMA DELTA MAGNETIC STRUCTURE. IT PRODUCED NEARLY ALL OF THE ACTIVITY OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5368 (S12W39) WAS AGAIN THE FOCUS OF ACTIVITY AS IT PRODUCED FOUR M-CLASS FLARES WITH THE LARGEST AN M7/0B AT 21/2358Z. A COMMON CHARACTERISTIC OF ALL THE FLARES WAS THE VERY SMALL OUTPUT OVER THE RADIO SPECTRUM. THE PLAGE IN THE REGION WAS ENHANCED MOST OF THE DAY, BUT IN WHITE LIGHT THE GROUP SHOWED SLIGHT DECAY. IT IS STILL MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX BUT LESS SO THAN YESTERDAY. ELSEWHERE, THE OTHER DISK REGIONS WERE GENERALLY QUIET AND STABLE. SURGING WAS NOTED AT VARIOUS SITES ON THE EAST LIMB WHERE THREE NEW REGIONS MAY BE ROTATING INTO VIEW.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. REGION 5368 SHOWS NO SIGNS OF ABATING ITS FLARE PRODUCTION AND M-CLASS ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE. X-CLASS FLARES ARE NOT ANTICIPATED, BUT IF THE CONDITIONS ARE RIGHT, AN ISOLATED EVENT MAY OCCUR.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED. AN EPISODE OF ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS WAS OBSERVED MIDWAY THROUGH THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE THROUGH 25 FEBRUARY.

REGIONS 5368 (S12W78) AND 5373 (N17W50) CONTINUE TO DOMINATE THE DISK IN SIZE AND COMPLEXITY BUT APPEAR TO BE DECLINING GRADUALLY. REGION 5377 (N15E42) SHOWED CONSIDERABLE GROWTH AND PRODUCED NUMEROUS SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. TWO SMALL REGIONS EMERGED ON THE DISK TODAY. THE EVENT LASTED FOR ABOUT AN HOUR AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK TYPE II RADIO SWEEP. REGION 5378 EXHIBITED STEADY GROWTH AND PENUMBRAL DEVELOPMENT DURING THE PERIOD AND PRODUCED THE MAJORITY OF TODAY'S NUMEROUS SUBFLARES. REGION 5379 (S20E05) CONTINUED TO GROW SLOWLY AND PRODUCED OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE ESSENTIALLY QUIET.

sections.text: LOW. REGIONS 5373, 5378, AND 5379 EACH POSE A SLIGHT THREAT FOR MODERATE LEVELS. A LULL IN ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED ON THE SECOND DAY AS REGION 5373 ROTATES OUT OF VIEW. AN INCREASE IS EXPECTED ON THE THIRD DAY WITH THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 5354 (N30, L-283) WHICH PRODUCED 11 M-CLASS FLARES AND 1 X-CLASS FLARE ON ITS PREVIOUS DISK TRANSIT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. TWO M-CLASS FLARES WERE OBSERVED TODAY:  AN M1 AT 1023Z  WHICH WAS NOT SEEN OPTICALLY, AND AN M2/SF AT 1213Z FROM REGION 5378 (N15W78). REGION 5378 PRODUCED SURGING AND A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM AT ABOUT N13 AS IT APPROACHED THE WEST LIMB. THE GROUP CONTINUES TO GROW. FOUR NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: THE MOST SIGNIFICANT OF THESE WAS REGION 5385 (N24E43) WHICH DEVELOPED INTO A D-CLASS GROUP AND PRODUCED A SUBFLARE. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE ESSENTIALLY QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. THE PRIMARY THREAT FOR M-CLASS FLARES OVER THE NEXT TWO DAYS IS REGION 5378. OLD REGION 5354 (N30, L-283), WHICH PRODUCED 11 M-CLASS FLARES AND 1 X-CLASS FLARE ON ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT IS DUE TO RETURN LATE ON THE SECOND DAY (03 MARCH) AND IS EXPECTED TO CONTRIBUTE SIGNIFICANTLY TO ACTIVITY AND BACKGROUND LEVELS AT THAT TIME.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 5378 MAY PRODUCE A BEHIND-THE-LIMB EVENT IN THE NEXT 24 HOURS. OLD REGION 5354 (N30, L-283) IS DUE TO RETURN LATE ON 03 MARCH. THIS REGION IS EXPECTED TO SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE ACTIVITY LEVELS.

sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. JUST ONE M-CLASS EVENT OCCURRED AND IT WAS AN M1 AT 0929Z. THE REST OF THE VISIBLE DISK WAS UNIMPRESSIVE AS ONLY C-CLASS SUBFLARES WERE OBSERVED. OLD REGION 5354 (N30, L-283) IS NOW DUE AT EAST LIMB BUT AS YET HAS NOT BEEN SEEN.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THE MAJORITY OF THE INTERVAL. HIGH LATITUDES EXPERIENCED SOME MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS. PARTICLE AND MAGNETIC DATA SUGGEST THE DISTURBANCE MAY HAVE STEMMED FROM A HIGH SPEED SOLAR WIND STREAM. THERE IS A SMALL EQUATORIAL CORONAL HOLE NOW LOCATED NEAR W30.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  SOLAR ACTIVITY INCREASED DRAMATICALLY TO HIGH WHEN NEW REGION 5395 (N31E70) PRODUCED A MAJOR FLARE AT 06/1405Z.  THIS FLARE WAS 3B OPTICALLY AND SATURATED THE GOES X-RAY SENSOR AT X12 (ESTIMATED PEAK IS X15).  SIGNIFICANT RADIO BURSTS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FLARE INCLUDING 25,000 SFU AT 2800 MHZ, 290,000 SFU AT 245 MHZ, AND STRONG TYPE II/IV SWEEP ACTIVITY. IN WHITE LIGHT THIS REGION APPEARS TO BE AN EXTREMELY LARGE GROUP WITH ALL VISIBLE SPOTS WITHIN THE SAME PENUMBRA. THIS REGION IS AT AN UNUSUALLY HIGH LATITUDE FOR SUCH A LARGE SUNSPOT GROUP.  REGION 5394 (S36E78) WAS ALSO NUMBERED. NOTE THAT THE DAILY OTTAWA 10.7 CM FLUX BELOW (212) IS ESTIMATED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  ADDITIONAL MAJOR FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM REGION 5394.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE WITH ISOLATED PERIODS OF MAJOR STORM AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE FIRST DAY OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.  ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED AS A RESULT OF TODAY'S MAJOR FLARE ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.  ISOLATED PERIODS OF MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM CONDITIONS MAY OCCUR AT HIGH LATITUDES WITH THIS DISTURBANCE. A SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV IS FORECAST TO BEGIN NEAR 0800Z ON 7 MARCH.  THE PEAK FLUX MAY REACH 150 PFU AT 07/2000Z.

sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5395 (N35E46) REMAINED LARGE AND MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX. IT PRODUCED SEVERAL M-CLASS FLARES INCLUDING AN M5/1B AT 08/0837Z, WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS, AN M1/2B AT 08/1450Z ASSOCIATED WITH A TYPE IV RADIO SWEEP BURST, AND AN M4 (OBSERVED BY THE SOLAR MAXIMUM MISSION SATELLITE) AT 08/1857Z. ONE OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED M2 X-RAY BURST OCCURRED AT 08/0833Z. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: 5397 (N35E61) AND 5398 (S16E68). BOTH WERE SMALL BIPOLES.

A SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV BEGAN AT 08/1735Z AND REMAINS IN PROGRESS. THUS FAR, THE MAXIMUM OBSERVED FLUX HAS BEEN 55 PFU AT 08/1755Z.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS WITH MOST OF THE STORMING EXPECTED TOMORROW. THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE IN RESPONSE TO THE X15/3B FLARE OF 6 MARCH. THE SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV IS EXPECTED TO END WITHIN THE NEXT 12 TO 24 HOURS.

sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5395 (N34E21) CONTINUED ITS MAJOR FLARE PRODUCTION WITH AN X4/3B AT 10/1922Z. THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MAJOR RADIO EMISSIONS INCLUDING A 12000 SFU TENFLARE AND TYPES II AND IV SWEEPS. THIS FLARE WAS IN PROGRESS AT THE END OF THE ANALYSIS PERIOD. THIS REGION PRODUCED SEVERAL M-CLASS EVENTS PRIOR TO THE X4, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS AN M1/1B AT 09/2321Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: 5400 (N12E65), A SMALL UNIPOLE, AND 5401 (S22E16), A SMALL BIPOLE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV WHICH BEGAN AT 08/1735Z REMAINED IN PROGRESS. THUS FAR, THE MAXIMUM OBSERVED FLUX WAS 270 PFU AT 10/0000Z. A POLAR-CAP ABSORPTION EVENT WAS OBSERVED AS WELL, WITH A MAXIMUM OBSERVED ABSORPTION OF 3.4 DB AT 09/2130Z.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE ON DAY ONE FOLLOWED BY A DAY OF MAJOR STORMING WHICH IS EXPECTED IN THE WAKE OF TODAY'S X4/3B FLARE. THE SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH AN ADDITIONAL ENHANCEMENT EXPECTED TO OCCUR NEAR 11/0000Z AS A RESULT OF TODAY'S FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5395 (N34W04) CONTINUED MAJOR FLARE PRODUCTION. THE LARGEST REACHED M7/2B LEVELS EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH ASSOCIATED TYPE IV RADIO SWEEP. sections.text: HIGH. REGION 5395 PROVIDES A GOOD CHANCE OF A PROTON PRODUCING FLARE, AS WELL AS A VERY GOOD CHANCE OF CONTINUED MAJOR FLARE PRODUCTION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 11/2100Z TO 12/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. THIS DISTURBANCE MAY BE THE CONSEQUENCE OF THE X15 FLARE OF 6 MAR 89. THE 10 MEV PROTON EVENT CONTINUED IN PROGRESS WITH A PEAK OF 440 PFU VERY LATE IN THE PERIOD. THIS WAS PROBABLY THE CONTRIBUTORY ACCUMULATION OF THE X4/3B FLARE OF 10 MAR 89 ENHANCING THE DECAYING 10 MEV PROTON EVENT THAT INITIALLY STARTED 08/1735Z. THE PCA EVENT ALSO CONTINUED IN PROGRESS AT THE END OF THE PERIOD. IT ALSO PEAKED OUT WITH A 4.8 DB LEVEL VERY LATE IN THE PERIOD.

sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5395 (N34W16) PRODUCED AN M6/2N AT 12/2103Z AND AN X1/3N AT 13/0137Z. ONLY MINOR TO MODERATE CENTIMETER BURSTS ACCOMPANIED THESE FLARES. PROPER MOTION AND SPOT ROTATION APPEAR TO BE OCCURRING IN THIS REGION, MAINTAINING A HIGH LEVEL OF FLARE PRODUCTION IN THE ABSENCE OF SIGNIFICANT GROWTH. SMALL REGION 5405 (N15W37) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.text: HIGH. REGION 5395 SHOULD CONTINUE TO PRODUCE 1-2 MAJOR EVENTS PER DAY FOR THE DURATION OF ITS DISK TRANSIT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT SEVERE STORM LEVELS. A 79 NANOTESLA SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS OBSERVED AT 13/0128Z FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 22 NANOTESLA AT 13/0747Z. K INDICES OF 6 OR GREATER FOLLOWED THE FIRST IMPULSE. AT MIDDAY, K INDICES OF 8 AND 9 WERE PREDOMINANT. THE 10 MEV PROTON EVENT CONTINUED, REACHING A PEAK FLUX OF 5300 PFU (APPROXIMATE) AT 13/0745Z. BY 13/1500Z THE PARTICLE FLUX DECREASED TO BELOW 100 PFU. THE POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT CONTINUED WITH A PEAK ABSORPTION OF 6 DB OBSERVED NEAR 13/0800Z. A FORBUSH DECREASE OF APPROXIMATELY 13 PERCENT WAS IN PROGRESS AT 13/2100Z.

sections.text: SHOULD BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR 14 MAR. IN THE ABSENCE OF FURTHER GEOEFFECTIVE FLARE ACTIVITY, ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS ARE PREDICTED FOR 15-16 MAR.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5395 (N34W27) WAS STILL AN FKC WITH OVER 3000 MILS. IT PRODUCED AN X1/2B FLARE AT 14/1731Z WITH MAJOR RADIO BURSTS, BUT NO SIGNIFICANT RADIO SWEEPS. IT ALSO PRODUCED SEVERAL M-CLASS AND LESSER FLARES THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. REGION 5395 PROVIDES A GOOD CHANCE OF A PROTON PRODUCING FLARE AND A VERY GOOD CHANCE OF CONTINUED MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 13/2100Z TO 14/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT SEVERE STORM LEVELS. THE PEAK OF ACTIVITY OCCURRED DURING THE INITIAL PERIODS AND PRODUCED K VALUES OF 9 AT BOTH MIDDLE AND HIGH LATITUDES. THIS STORM IS ATTRIBUTED TO REGION 5395'S X4 FLARE OF 10 MAR. THE 10 MEV PROTON EVENT ENDED MIDWAY THROUGH THE PERIOD. THE PEAK VALUE WAS ABOUT 3000 PFU AT 13/0745Z. THIS LONG DURATION EVENT WAS THE ACCUMULATIVE CONTRIBUTION OF AT LEAST TWO MAJOR FLARES FROM REGION 5395. THE ACCOMPANYING PCA EVENT MAY ALSO BE NEAR ITS END. THE FORBUSH DECREASE CONTINUES IN PROGRESS NOW.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR STORM TO ACTIVE LEVELS THE FIRST TWO DAYS AS THE FIELD RECOVERS. THE LAST DAY IS EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE TO UNSETTELED UNTIL A SMALL DISTURBANCE FROM TODAY'S X1 FLARE STARTS. IT IS NOT EXPECTED TO BE AT ANY MORE THAN A MINOR STORM LEVEL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 14/2100Z
sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5395 (N34W42) HAS STARTED A VERY SLOW DECAY IN H-A PENUMBRA. IT WAS NOT GREATLY CHANGED IN MOST OTHER ASPECTS. IT PRODUCED ONE MAJOR FLARE OF M8/2B CATAGORY WITH MAJOR RADIO BURSTS BUT AGAIN, AS HAS NOW COME TO BE THE RULE WITH THIS REGION, NO SIGNIFICANT RADIO SWEEPS. IT RETAINS ITS FKC AND OVER 3000 MILS CHARACTERISTICS. NEWLY NUMBERED REGION 5409 (N21E74) IS RETURNING NEAR WHERE OLD REGION 5378 WAS LOCATED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. REGION 5395 PROVIDES A GOOD CHANCE OF A PROTON PRODUCING FLARE AND A VERY GOOD CHANCE OF CONTINUED MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. ITS PENUMBRA DECAY MAY BE PRECURSOR TO INCREASED PRODUCTION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 14/2100Z TO 15/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT MAJOR STORM TO ACTIVE LEVELS. THE STORM THAT STARTED MONDAY HAS ALMOST ENDED. THE FORBUSH DECREASE MAY ALSO HAVE ENDED, BUT DATA LOSS PREVENTS OFFICIAL DECLARATION. NO FURTHER 10 MEV PROTON ENHANCEMENTS, NOR PCA EVENTS HAVE RECURRED SINCE THEIR TERMINATION YESTERDAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. THE ALMOST CON- -TINUAL MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY DURING THE PAST FIVE DAYS SUPPORTS ENHANCED GEOMAGNETIC LEVELS ABOVE RECURRENCE. THE PROJECTED DISTURBANCE OF 17-18 MAR IS EXPECTED IN RESPONSE TO THE X1/2B FLARE OF 14 MAR. THE FORBUSH DECREASE IS EXPECTED TO END SOON.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5395 (N33W52) HAS CHANGED VERY LITTLE OVERNIGHT. IT PRODUCED ANOTHER LARGE, MAJOR FLARE LATE IN THE PERIOD, AN X3/2B FLARE. THIS FLARE CONTAINED MAJOR RADIO BURSTS, BUT NO SIGNIFICANT RADIO SWEEPS. IT PEAKED AT 16/1527Z. OTHER MAJOR AND MINOR FLARES WERE ALSO PRODUCED BY THE REGION IN THE PERIOD. IT RETAINED THE VERY LARGE SIZE AND COMPLEX CLASSIFICATION CONSISTENT WITH IT'S DISK HISTORY. THE 10.7 CM FLUX WAS NOT AVAILABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. REGION 5395 STILL PROVIDES A GOOD CHANCE OF A PROTON PRODUCING FLARE, AND A CONTINUED VERY GOOD CHANCE OF MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT GENERALLY MINOR STORM LEVELS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OCCURRED AT 16/0532Z WITH A 67 NANOTESLA JUMP. MAJOR PERIODS FOLLOWED AT MIDDLE AND HIGH LATITUDES. THIS IS CONSIDERED A CONTINUATION OF THE SEVERE STORM THAT STARTED MONDAY. THE FORBUSH DECREASE REMAINS IN PROGRESS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE. THE ALMOST CONTINUAL MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY RECENTLY, SUPPORTS ENHANCED GEOMAGNETIC LEVELS ABOVE RECURRENT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS. THE LACK OF RELIABLE STORM INDI- CATORS PRECLUDES FORCASTING GREATER LEVELS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 16/2100Z
sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY CONTINUED HIGH. REGION 5395 (N34W69) PRODUCED ITS SECOND LARGEST FLARE TO DATE, AN X6/3B TENFLARE, VISIBLE IN WHITE LIGHT, AT 1744Z. THE EVENT ALSO INCLUDED DISCRETE BURSTS OF THOUSANDS OF FLUX UNITS AS WELL AS IMPORTANCE 3 TYPE II AND TYPE IV SWEEP. THE REGION ALSO GENERATED OTHER SIGNIFICANT FLARES: AN X1/1B AT 16/2045, AN M2/3N AT 0247, AN M6/2B AT 0719, AND AN M4/2N AT 1113Z. REGION 5403 (S14E11) ALSO CONTRIBUTED AN M1/2B AT 2017Z.

sections.text: AT HIGH LEVELS THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD. REGION 5395 IS STILL CAPABLE OF ADDITIONAL X-CLASS ACTIVITY, AND REGION 5403 HAS SHOWN IT CAN PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT MID-LATITUDES AND MINOR TO MAJOR STORM THRESHOLDS AT HIGH LATITUDES. A SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV BEGAN AT 1855Z, APPROXIMATELY ONE HOUR AFTER THE X6/3B FLARE. THIS FAST RESPONSE IS REASONABLE FOR A FLARE FROM W60 HELIOLONGITUDE. THE MAXIMUM, AT THIS WRITING, IS 240 PFU. A POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT BEGAN VERY LATE IN THE SUMMARY PERIOD.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THE BRUNT OF THE ACTIVITY IS ANTICIPATED TO OCCUR 19 MARCH AS A RESULT OF TODAY'S X6/3B FLARE.

sections.text: HIGH THE NEXT 48 HOURS AND MODERATE THEREAFTER. REGION 5395 IS NOW MORE DIFFICULT TO ANALYZE BUT, GIVEN ITS TRACK RECORD, MUST STILL BE CONSIDERED A POTENTIAL X-CLASS PRODUCER. ALSO, M-CLASS ACTIVITY MAY OCCUR IN REGION 5403 AS WELL AS THE GROUP NOW PERCHED ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS PREDOMINANTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED THE FIRST PART OF THE INTERVAL. THE POLAR CAP ABSORPTION ALSO CONTINUES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5409 (N18W34) PRODUCED AN X1/3B FLARE STARTING AT 23/1959Z. THE EVENT WAS LONG DURATION AND KEPT THE X-RAY FLUX ABOVE M-LEVEL FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY STRONG TYPE II AND TYPE IV SWEEPS AND STRONG DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. THE REGION HAS BEEN UNDER FRAGMENTATION AND SIMPLIFICATION THROUGHOUT THE DAY. THERE WERE NO ADDITIONAL CLASS M OR GREATER FLARES DURING THE DAY. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK WAS QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5409 IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO DECAY AND IS LIKELY TO PRODUCE ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A SLIGHT BUT REDUCED CHANCE FOR A MAJOR FLARE FROM THE REGION: TODAY'S EVENT PROBABLY REDUCED THE MAJOR FLARE CAPABILITY OF THE REGION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY ACTIVE WITH OCCASIONAL MINOR STORM PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES. A PROTON EVENT OF MORE THAN 10 PFU AT GREATER THAN 10MEV BEGAN AT 2025Z IN RESPONSE TO TODAY'S MAJOR SOLAR FLARE. THE EVENT CONTINUES IN PROGRESS AT THIS TIME. THE MAXIMUM FLUX OBSERVED SO FAR HAS BEEN 41 PFU AT 2120Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE TOMORROW AND THROUGH MOST OF THE SECOND DAY. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE FORE- CAST BASED ON TODAY'S FLARE ACTIVITY. THE DISTURBANCE IS EX- PECTED TO START LATE ON THE SECOND DAY AND SHOULD LAST THROUGH THE THIRD DAY. THE PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO REACH A MAXIMUM OF 100 PFU AT GREATER THAN 10MEV EARLY ON THE FIRST DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5409 (N20W60) PRODUCED THE DAY'S LARGEST EVENT: A C6/SN AT 1535Z. THIS REGION IS THE ONLY GROUP ON THE SOLAR DISK PRODUCING SUBFLARES AND CONTINUES TO DECLINE IN SIZE AND COMPLEXITY. AN ERUPTIVE PROM- INENCE WAS OBSERVED ON THE WEST LIMB AT N36 AT THE SAME TIME THE C6 FLARE WAS IN PROGRESS. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 5409 CONTINUES TO POSE A THREAT FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 24/2100Z TO 25/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD UNTIL ABOUT 1200Z, WHEN CONDITIONS BECAME QUIET TO UNSETTLED. SINCE ABOUT 1800Z CONDITIONS HAVE BEEN MOSTLY UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE INCREASE MAY MARK THE BEGINNING OF EFFECTS FROM THE X1/3B FLARE THAT OCCURRED ON 23 MARCH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS TOMORROW AND PARTWAY THROUGH THE SECOND DAY AS THE DISTURBANCE INTENSIFIES. CONDITIONS SHOULD GRADUALLY SUBSIDE TO UNSETTLED LEVELS WITH OCCASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS THEREAFTER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5409 (N18W74) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS FLARE: AN M6/2N AT 1313Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY STRONG TYPE II AND TYPE IV SWEEPS AND MODERATE DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. THE EVENT WAS OBSERVED TO PRODUCE BRIGHT SURGING ON THE DISK AND ON THE LIMB OUT TO .20 SOLAR RADII. REGION 5409 CONTINUES TO DECLINE. THE ONLY OTHER SOLAR ACTIVITY DURING THE PERIOD CONSISTED OF OC- CASIONAL SUBFLARE FLUCTUATIONS FROM REGIONS 5409 AND 5417 (S26E13). THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET.

sections.text: LOW. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT FROM REGION 5409.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED. A BRIEF PERIOD OF ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS OCCURRED FROM 1030-1500Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE TOMORROW IN RESPONSE TO RECENT SOLAR FLARE ACTIVITY. CONDITIONS SHOULD SUBSIDE TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES ARE POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 5409 AND 5417.  MAJOR FLARES ARE NOT EXPECTED.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE UNTIL 27/1342Z WHEN A SUDDEN STORM COMMENCEMENT (SSC) WAS OBSERVED (33 NANOTESLA IN BOULDER).  THE FIELD WAS AT ACTIVE TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS THEREAFTER.  THIS ACTIVITY COULD BE IN RESPONSE TO FLARE ACTIVITY IN REGION 5409.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE DURING THE NEXT 24 HOURS AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE SUBSIDES.  UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THE REMAINING TWO DAYS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.  MINOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES ON THE SECOND DAY.

sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN M1 OCCURRED AT 02/1540Z. THIS X-RAY BURST WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A BRIGHT SURGE (TO .22 RV) OBSERVED NEAR N31E90. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION COMPLEX 5441 (N35 E08) PRODUCED AN X3/4B FLARE AT 09/0105Z WITH RADIO PARAMETERS INCLUDING A TYPE IV SWEEP AND 10.7 CM BURST. ITS RAPID GROWTH DURING THE PRIOR 36 HOURS WITH THE APPARENT EMERGENCE OF THREE CLOSE GROUPS CULMINATED IN THE FLARE EVENT. WHITE LIGHT ASPECTS AND ASSOCIATED MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION HAVE BOTH SIMPLIFIED SINCE THE EVENT. THE OVERALL X-RAY BACKGROUD THRESHOLD HAS ALSO AGAIN DROPPED TO RELATIVELY LOWER LEVELS.

sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN M1 X-RAY FLARE, ASSOCIATED WITH THE ERUPTION OF A FILAMENT LOCATED NEAR N69E24, OCCURRED AT 10/2323Z. LITTLE FLARE ACTIVITY OF SIGNIFICANCE OCCURRED SINCE THAT TIME. REGIONS 5441 (N34W15) AND 5438 (S16W36), THE TWO MOST INTERESTING REGIONS VISIBLE, DECAYED AND SIMPLIFIED. sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  REGIONS 5441 AND 5438 ARE STILL CAPABLE OF AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 10/2100Z TO 11/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT ALL LATITUDES UNTIL A 10 NANOTESLA SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS DETECTED AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ORBIT AT 1437Z. A SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV BEGAN SHORTLY THEREAFTER WITH THE MAXIMUM TO THIS POINT 130 PFU AT 2030Z. A POLAR CAP ABSORPTION BEGAN AROUND 1900Z AND IS STILL IN PROGRESS. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS HAVE PREVAILED SINCE THE SUDDEN IMPULSE. THIS ACTIVITY IS THOUGHT TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH THE X3/4B FLARE EARLY ON 09 APRIL.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THE DISTURBANCE SHOULD THEN ABATE WITH UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS EVIDENT 14 APRIL.

REGION 5454 (S21W98) QUIETLY CROSSED THE WEST LIMB. REGION 5464 (S18E07) ENTERED A SLOW DECAY PHASE. REGION 5470 (N29E73) GREW SLOWLY. NO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGIONS 5464 AND 5470 ARE CAPABLE OF C-CLASS FLARE PRODUCTION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. HIGHER LATITUDES RECORDED ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND AT MINOR STORM TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT HIGHER LATITUDES BASED UPON THE RECURRENT PATTERN.

sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5470 (N29E48) PRODUCED A MODERATE DURATION M5/SN AT 01/0114Z. CORRELATIVE RADIO BURSTS WERE SMALL TO MODERATE WITH NO TYPE II OR IV SWEEPS REPORTED. THIS REGION GREW RAPIDLY DURING THE LAST TWO DAYS AND IS EMERGING IN AN AREA NEAR WHERE RECORD SETTING REGION 5395 (N34 L=257) WAS LOCATED IN MARCH. REGION 5464 (S18W03) WAS STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE
sections.text: MODERATE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THE RAPID GROWTH IN REGION 5470 MAKES CLASS M FLARES FROM THIS REGION LIKELY. SHOULD THIS GROWTH TREND CONTINUE, CLASS X FLARES WILL BECOME A DISTINCT POSSIBILITY.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR MOST OF THE PERIOD. SLIGHTLY ACTIVE LEVELS WERE EXPERIENCED AT THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5470 (N30E36) PRODUCED AN M2/1N FLARE AT 02/0416Z AND A LONG DURATION M1/1N AT 02/1640Z. THIS REGION CEASED GROWING AND STABILIZED IN WHITE LIGHT AREA.   REGION 5470 REMAINED SOMEWHAT COMPLEX MAGNETICALLY. REGION 5464 (S19W14) PRODUCED AN M3/2B FLARE AT 02/1905Z. TYPE II AND IV SWEEPS ACCOMPANIED THE FLARE. THIS REGION REMAINS STABLE IN AREA AND ALSO POSSESSES A MODERATE AMOUNT OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A MODERATE LEVEL FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THE CLASS M FLARE PRODUCTION FROM REGION 5470 SHOULD BEGIN TO DECLINE DUE TO THE RECENT STABILIZATION. ANOTHER CLASS M FLARE FROM REGION 5464 IS POSSIBLE, BUT THE FREQUENCY OF OCCURRENCE SHOULD BE LOW FROM THIS AGING REGION. A LOW PROBABILITY EXISTS FOR A CLASS X FLARE FROM EITHER REGION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 01/2100Z TO 02/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY ACTIVE FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A BELOW EVENT THRESHOLD PARTICLE ENHANCEMENT WAS IN PROGRESS FOR MOST OF THE PERIOD. A MAXIMUM FLUX OF APPROXIMATELY 6 PFU WAS OBSERVED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE AT ACTIVE TO OCCASIONALLY MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THE M3 FLARE FROM REGION 5464 IS EXPECTED TO CAUSE MINOR STORM CONDITIONS BEGINNING LATE ON 04 MAY AND CONTINUING INTO 05 MAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5470 (N29E24) PRODUCED A MODERATE DURATION X2/3B FLARE AT 03/0358Z. NO TYPE II OR IV EVENTS WERE OBSERVED BUT A TEN CENTIMETER BURST OF 1100 FLUX UNITS WAS OBSERVED. REGION 5470 BEGAN TO GROW AGAIN DURING THE PERIOD AND NOW A DELTA CONFIGURATION IS VISIBLE. THE SMM CORONAGRAPH OBSERVED A CORONAL MASS EJECTION OFF THE EAST LIMB AT ABOUT 03/0515Z - NO SPEED INFORMATION AVAILABLE. THIS CME IS LIKELY RELATED TO THE CLASS X FLARE FROM 5470. REGION 5464 (S19W26) PRODUCED AN M1/1N FLARE AT 03/1948Z. THIS FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A TYPE II BURST. A DELTA MAY BE FORMING IN REGION 5464.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE RESURGENCE OF GROWTH AND INCREASE IN MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY IN REGION 5470 MAKE THIS REGION A GOOD CANDIDATE FOR CONTINUED CLASS M AND OCCASIONAL CLASS X FLARE PRODUCTION. REGION 5464 SHOULD ADD TO CLASS M FLARE TOTALS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 02/2100Z TO 03/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE AT ACTIVE LEVELS ON 04 MAY IN RESPONSE TO A FLARE FROM REGION 5464 ON 02 MAY. MINOR STORM TO OCCASIONALLY MAJOR STORM LEVELS SHOULD BE EXPERIENCED ON 05-06 MAY IN RESPONSE TO THE AFOREMENTIONED X2 FLARE FROM REGION 5470.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5464 (S19W38) GREW DRAMATICALLY DURING THE PERIOD AND IS NOW A LARGE CLASS EKC SUNSPOT GROUP WITH A BETA GAMMA DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. THE REGION PRODUCED THE FOLLOWING FLARES - AN M4/2B AT 04/0424Z WITH A TYPE II, AN M2/SN AT 04/0824Z, AN M5/2N AT 04/1115Z WITH A WEAK TYPE II AND STRONG TYPE IV, AN M1/1B AT 04/1842Z, AND AN M1/SB AT 04/2041Z. REGION 5470 (N28E11) ALSO GREW DURING THE PERIOD, PRODUCING AN M1/1N AT 03/2104UT AND A MODERATE DURATION M2/SN AT 04/1927Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A GENERALLY HIGH LEVEL. GROWTH AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY IN BOTH REGIONS 5464 AND 5470 BODE WELL FOR THE PRODUCTION OF CLASS M FLARES AND BOTH ARE CAPABLE OF X CLASS FLARE PRODUCTION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 03/2100Z TO 04/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.text: SHOULD BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE ENTIRE PERIOD. INTERMITTENT MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY DURING 05 AND 06 MAY.  A PROTON EVENT DURING THE PERIOD IS ALSO POSSIBLE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 04/2100Z
sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5470 (N29W00) PRODUCED AN X2/3B AT 05/0737Z WITH A LONG DURATION TYPE IV AND TEN CENTIMETER BURST OF 1000 FLUX UNITS. THIS REGION REMAINED MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX BUT CEASED ITS LATEST GROWTH TREND. REGION 5464 (S18W52) CONTINUED TO GROW BUT AT A REDUCED RATE. THE MAGNETIC FIELDS RETAIN THEIR MIXED NATURE IN THIS REGION BUT ONE OF THE DELTA CONFIGURATIONS MAY BE DECAYING.  REGION 5464 PRODUCED AN M1/1N AT 04/2224Z AND AN M1/1B AT 05/0532Z. NEITHER FLARE PRODUCED SIGNIFICANT RADIO BURSTS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A GENERALLY HIGH LEVEL. BOTH REGIONS 5464 AND 5470 ARE CAPABLE OF GENERATING MID CLASS M TO CLASS X FLARES. CURRENT TRENDS INDICATE THAT THE FREQUENCY OF THESE LARGE EVENTS MAY DECREASE DURING THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 04/2100Z TO 05/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT MID LATITUDES WHILE HIGH LATITUDES EXPERIENCED ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS. THE MOST DISTURBED PERIOD WAS 05/0000Z-1030Z. THIS DISTURBANCE WAS PRECEDED BY A SUDDEN STORM COMMENCEMENT OF 80 GAMMA AT 04/2355Z. A WEAK PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 05/0905Z, REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 27 PFU AT 05/1000Z, AND AT THE END OF THE PERIOD WAS NEARLY OVER.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE GENERALLY AT MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST PERIOD. PULSES OF MAJOR STORM LEVELS SHOULD BE EXPERIENCED AS THE SHOCK FRONTS FROM THE MANY RECENT FLARES REACH EARTH. ACTIVE CONDITIONS SHOULD PREVAIL BETWEEN THE PULSES.  ANOTHER PROTON EVENT, OF HIGHER FLUX, IS POSSIBLE DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5476 (S31E51) PRODUCED TWO M-LEVEL X-RAY FLARES. THE LARGEST WAS AN M4/2B AT 06/1702Z. THIS REGION APPEARS TO BE IN A RAPID GROWTH PHASE. REGION 5464 (S19W39) PRODUCED AN M1/SN AT 06/1451Z, THIS FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A TYPE II AND TYPE IV RADIO EMISSION. REGION 5464 AND 5470 (N29W12) HAVE MAINTAINED A BETA-GAMMA-DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. REGION 5464 APPEARS TO BE IN A SLOW DECAY PHASE. ONE NEW REGION WAS NUMBERED TODAY, REGION 5477 (N09E41) A SIMPLE UNIPOLAR SPOT GROUP.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. THE THREE REGIONS MENTIONED ABOVE 5464, 5470, AND 5476 ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THEIR M-LEVEL FLARE PRODUCTION AND MAY ELEVATE ACTIVITY TO HIGH CONDITIONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 05/2100Z TO 06/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY AT ACTIVE LEVELS FOR BOTH MIDDLE AND HIGH LATITUDES. THE PROTON EVENT THAT BEGAN AT 05/0905Z ENDED AT 05/2210Z. ANOTHER PROTON EVENT BEGAN ON 06/0235Z AND HAS REACHED A TENTATIVE MAXIMUM OF 110 PFU AT GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO 10MEV AT 06/1045Z. THIS EVENT IS STILL IN PROGRESS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR STORM LEVELS THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. THIS IS BASED ON THE X2/3B FLARE OF 05 MAY AS WELL AS THE FLARE ACTIVITY OUTLINED IN SECTION 1A ABOVE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 06/2100Z
sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. FLARE ACTIVITY WAS CONFINED TO C-CLASS SINCE YESTERDAY BUT THE DISK HAS BEEN INTERESTING DUE TO THE APPEARANCE OF FOUR NEW REGIONS. NEW REGION 5479 (N13E20) WAS BORN VERY NEAR TWO OLDER SPOT GROUPS AND MAY INTERACT WITH THEM TO PRODUCE FLARES SOON. AMONG THE MATURE GROUPS VISIBLE REGIONS 5464 (S19W78), 5470 (N29W25), AND 5476 (S30E38) ARE THE MOST IMPRESSIVE. A LARGE PROMINENCE SPANNING 25 DEGREES ON THE SW LIMB LIFTED OFF BETWEEN 2135 AND 2205Z ON 6 MAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. THE CURRENT LULL IN M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS LIKELY TO END SOON AS ANY OF THE AFOREMENTIONED REGIONS MAY BECOME ACTIVE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 06/2100Z TO 07/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT MID-LATITUDES SINCE 0515Z WHEN A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 90 NANOTESLA WAS RECORDED AT BOULDER. HIGH LATITUDE SITES HAVE BEEN RELATIVELY MORE DISTURBED. THE X2/3B FLARE OF 5 MAY FROM DISK CENTER IS THOUGHT TO HAVE FUELED THE DISTURB- ANCE. THE PROTON EVENT AT 10 MEV CONTINUES BUT IS SLOWLY DECAYING.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO REMAIN AT MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR ANOTHER DAY. ACTIVITY SHOULD THEN SUBSIDE WITH UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS LIKELY 10 MAY.

sections.text: PERSIST AT THE MODERATE LEVEL. M-LEVEL ACTIVITY MAY OCCUR IN REGIONS 5464, 5470, OR 5476 (S30E25).

sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  REGION 5495 (N22W25) CONTINUED TO EMERGE RAPIDLY, INCREASING IN SUNSPOT AREA BY A FACTOR OF THREE.  FURTHER DEVELOPMENT MAY LEAD TO A DELTA CONFIGURATION IN THE TRAILER SUNSPOTS.  REGION 5497 (S20E31) ALSO CONTINUED TO GROW BUT AT A SLOWER RATE.  SUBFLARE ACTIVITY HAS INCREASED IN BOTH REGIONS.  AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED LONG DURATION C5 FLARE OCCURRED AT 20/0929Z. THIS FLARE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A TYPE II SWEEP AND MINOR DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS.  THE SOURCE OF THIS FLARE MAY BE BEYOND THE EAST LIMB.  THREE REGIONS WERE NUMBERED SINCE YESTERDAY - 5499 (S06W00), 5500 (S12W16), AND 5501 (N33E35).

REGION 5497 (S20W09) REMAINED THE MOST IMPRESSIVE GROUP ON THE DISK WHILE INCREASING IN SPOT COUNT AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 15 NANOTESLAS OCCURRED AT 23/1128Z FOLLOWED BY A SECOND IMPULSE OF 68 NANOTESLAS AT 23/1347Z. A GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 23/1135Z, REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 68 PFU AT 23/1350Z, AND ENDED AT 23/1655Z. A POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT BEGAN AT 23/1312Z, REACHED A MAXIMUM ABSORPTION VALUE OF 2.4 DB AT 23/1314Z, AND ENDED AT 23/1919Z. ALL OF THE ABOVE ACTIVITY IS BELIEVED TO BE THE RESULT OF A LONG-DURATION C5 X-RAY EVENT WHICH OCCURRED ON 20 MAY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THROUGH 25 MAY. THE FINAL DAY IS EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE. THIS ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED AS A RESULT OF THE M5/2B FLARE WHICH OCCURRED ON 22 MAY. CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS ARE EXPECTED TO DISTURB THE FIELD ON 25-26 MAY.

sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH DUE TO THE NUMBER OF M-CLASS EVENTS DURING THE PERIOD. THE MAJORITY OF THE FLARE ACTIVITY WAS FROM REGION 5521 (S19E24) WHICH SHOWED A SLIGHT SIMPLIFICATION DURING THE DAY.   M-CLASS EVENTS FROM 5521 WERE AS FOLLOWS:  M3/SN AT 0155Z,  M1/1N AT 1012Z,  M1/SN AT 1054Z, M1/SN AT 1918Z. AN ADDITIONAL M-CLASS EVENT, AN M2/SF AT 2054Z, WAS ASSOCIATED WITH NEW REGION 5530 (S10E85). SOLAR FLUX LEVELS SHOWED A SIGNIFICANT UPWARD TREND NEAR THE END OF THE PERIOD PRIMARILY DUE TO THE ENTRANCE OF 5530 AND NEW REGION 5528 (N17E72). BOTH REGIONS DISPLAYED SIGNIFICANT SURGE ACTIVITY ON THE EAST LIMB THROUGHOUT THE DAY AND 5528 WAS REPORTED TO DISPLAY STRONG YELLOW LINE EMISSION AS WELL. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE RELATIVELY QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. THE PRIMARY THREATS FOR SIGNIFICANT FLARE ACTIVITY ARE CONSIDERED TO BE 5521, 5528, AND 5530.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 06/2100Z TO 07/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD, INITIALLY QUIET, ATTAINED STORM LEVELS DURING THE PERIOD AND RETURNED TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS BY THE END OF THE DAY.  THE STORM BEGAN WITH A SUDDEN COMMENCEMENT AT 2315Z, BUT ENDED MARKEDLY AT ABOUT 1230Z. MID-LATITUDES PEAKED AT MINOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE DISTURBANCE AND HIGH LATITUDES ATTAINED MAJOR STORM LEVELS BRIEFLY. THE DISTURBANCE WAS PROBABLY CAUSED BY THE SOLAR ACTIVITY THAT OCCURRED ON 03 JUNE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. SUBSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME HOURS FOR THE FIRST DAY. SOLAR CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ACTIVITY LATE ON THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5521 (S19E11) PRODUCED AN M1/1N FLARE AT 0922Z. THE REGION CONTINUES TO BE THE MOST FLARE PRODUCTIVE ON THE DISK AS IT SLOWLY DECAYS. AN UNCORRELATED M2 FLARE OCCURRED AT 1405Z. AN ERUPTIVE PROM- INENCE WAS OBSERVED ON THE WEST LIMB AT N10 AND WAS CORRELATED WITH A LONG DURATION X-RAY EVENT FROM 1715-1850Z: THE PEAK FLUX WAS M1 AT 1753Z AND THE MAXIMUM EXTENT OBSERVED WAS 0.28 RADII. NEW REGION 5528 (N21E72) PRODUCED NUMEROUS SUBFLARE FLUCTUATIONS DURING THE DAY AND HAS MORE FULLY ROTATED INTO VIEW AS A LARGE, D-TYPE REGION. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK WAS RELATIVELY STABLE AND QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. THE PRIMARY THREATS FOR MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY ARE REGIONS 5521 AND 5528.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED WITH OCCASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 48 GAMMA, HOWEVER, OCCURRED AT 1955Z AND WAS FOLLOWED BY MINOR STORM CONDITIONS FOR THE LAST HOUR OF THE PERIOD. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR THE EVENT WAS THE M6/2F FLARE FROM REGION 5521 THAT OCCURRED LATE ON 04 JUNE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. OCCASIONAL SUBSTORM PERIODS MAY OCCUR IN LOCAL NIGHTTIME SECTORS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5521 (S21W02) PRODUCED TWO M-CLASS EVENTS TODAY. THE FIRST FLARE WAS A LONG DURATION M2/2F WHICH ATTAINED MAXIMUM AT 0030Z AND LASTED ABOUT TWO HOURS. THE EVENT WAS ASSOCIATED WITH MODERATE TYPE II AND TYPE IV RADIO SWEEPS. THE SECOND FLARE WAS AN M1/SF AT 1635Z. THIS REGION EXHIBITED STEADY DECAY AND SIMPLIFICATION THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. REGION 5528 (N21E62) NOW DOMINATES THE DISK IN SIZE (1580 MILLIONTHS) AND PLAGE COVERAGE BUT PRODUCED ONLY OCCASIONAL SMALL SUBFLARES. NEW REGION 5533 (S18E78) ROTATED INTO VIEW TODAY, PRODUCING FREQUENT SUBFLARE FLUCTUATIONS INCLUDING AN M1 AT 1635Z. AN UNCORRELATED M2 OCCURRED AT 2029Z. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE RELATIVELY QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 5521 AND 5528 ARE THE MOST LIKELY TO PRODUCE MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. REGIONS 5530 AND 5533 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO MODERATE LEVELS OF ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 08/2100Z TO 09/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS DISTURBED BEGINNING WITH YESTERDAY'S SUDDEN IMPULSE AT 08/1955Z THROUGH ABOUT 09/0600Z. CONDITIONS WERE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS WITH OCCASIONAL PERIODS OF MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES. SUBSEQUENTLY THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD DECLINED TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS WITH OCCASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR THE DISTURBANCE WAS THE M6/2F FLARE FROM REGION 5521 THAT OCCURRED LATE ON 04 JUNE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. EFFECTS FROM YESTERDAY'S ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE AND TODAY'S LONG DURATION EVENT MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO INCREASED LEVELS OF GEOMAGNETIC ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 09/2100Z
sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  SEVERAL M-CLASS FLARES WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PAST DAY.  THE LARGEST FLARES OCCURRED IN REGION 5533 (S17E68) - AN M6/SF AT 09/2254Z AND AN M5/2N AT 10/0625Z.  THIS REGION CONTINUES TO ROTATE INTO VIEW AND IS PRESENTLY SEEN AS A MODERATELY LARGE E-TYPE SUNSPOT GROUP. REGIONS 5521 (S21W17) AND 5528 (N20E45) ALSO PRODUCED M-CLASS ACTIVITY.  REGION 5528 IS THE LARGEST SUNSPOT GROUP ON THE DISK AS A LARGE F-TYPE GROUP.  REGION 5521 IS DECAYING.  NEW REGION 5534 (N12E75) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH.  ADDITIONAL ENERGETIC FLARES ARE LIKELY FROM REGIONS 5521, 5528, AND 5533.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 09/2100Z TO 10/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT STORM LEVELS FOR MOST OF THE PAST DAY.  A MINOR GEOMAGNETIC STORM BEGAN AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AS A GRADUAL ONSET AT ABOUT 10/0215Z.  THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD HAS BEEN AT MAJOR STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR STORM TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS.  THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO RETURN TO ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS BY THE THIRD DAY OF THE FORECAST AS THE PRESENT DISTURBANCE ENDS.

sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  REGION 5528 (N21E15) WAS THE PRIMARY CONTRIBUTOR TO A LONG DURATION M1 FLARE THAT REACHED A MAXIMUM AT 13/1327Z.  REGIONS 5533 (S19E32) AND NEW REGION 5536 (N16E23) ALSO ADDED TO THIS M-LEVEL FLARE.  REGION 5536 IS A SIGNIFICANT EMERGENCE OF NEW FLUX NEAR REGION 5528.  REGION 5528 REMAINS THE LARGEST, MOST COMPLEX REGION ON THE DISK.  THREE OTHER NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED SINCE YESTERDAY - 5537 (N31E44), 5538 (N19E58), AND 5539 (S06W80). REGION 5539 EMERGED TO THE WEST OF OLD SPOTLESS REGION 5532 (S11W63).

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  THE LIKELIHOOD OF AN ENERGETIC FLARE IN REGION 5528 HAS INCREASED SINCE THE EMERGENCE OF REGION 5536. REGION 5533 IS ALSO CAPABLE OF ENERGETIC FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  M-CLASS FLARE ACTIVITY OCCURRED IN REGIONS 5521 (S16W74) AND 5528 (N21W04). REGION 5521 IS A SMALL, DECAYING SUNSPOT GROUP APPROACHING THE WEST LIMB AND PRODUCED AN M2/1N FLARE AT 14/1355Z AND AN M1/SF AT 14/1644Z.  THE M2 FLARE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A SPRAY, STRONG TYPE IV SWEEP, AND A 2695 MHZ RADIO BURST OF 390 SFU. REGION 5528 REMAINS THE LARGEST, MOST COMPLEX SUNSPOT GROUP ON THE DISK AND PRODUCED TWO M1/SF FLARES AT 14/1553Z AND 14/1820Z.  NEW REGIONS NUMBERED TODAY INCLUDE 5540 (S24W03), 5541 (S10E66), AND 5542 (S20E80).

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 14/2100Z
sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5533 (S19E06) PRODUCED AN X4/3B FLARE AT 15/1916Z. THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MAJOR TYPES II AND IV SWEEP BURSTS AND SIGNIFICANT DISCRETE BURSTS ACROSS THE SPECTRUM. THREE M-CLASS FLARES WERE REPORTED DURING THE PERIOD THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS AN M2/SF FROM REGION 5528 (N20W16). MINOR DISCRETE RADIO EMISSIONS ACCOMPANIED THE FLARE. THREE NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED: 5544 (N21E73), 5545 (N11W45), AND 5546 (N27W35).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. M-CLASS FLARING IS LIKELY FROM REGIONS 5528 AND 5533. THESE REGIONS ARE ALSO CAPABLE OF ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 14/2100Z TO 15/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD HAS BEEN AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS TOMORROW FOLLOWED BY TWO DAYS OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORM STORMING AS A RESULT OF TODAY'S X4/3B FLARE. A SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN VERY EARLY IN THE PERIOD AND REACH A MAXIMUM OF 123 PFU NEAR 16/0100Z.

sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5528 (N20W54) PRODUCED THE ONLY M-CLASS EVENT OF THE PERIOD: AN M1/SN AT 18/1905Z THAT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS. THIS REGION HAS BEEN IN A STATE OF GRADUAL DECAY, BUT REMAINS A LARGE AND VERY COMPLEX REGION. REGION 5533 (S19W32) WAS RELATIVELY QUIET AND CONTINUED TO DECAY. A MAJOR TYPE II SWEEP OCCURRED AT 18/1451Z ASSOCIATED WITH A SUBFAINT FLARE FROM REGION 5534 (N17W24). TWO NEW REGIONS EMERGED: 5550 (S21E03) AND 5551 (S12E41). BOTH WERE SMALL BIPOLES.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. M-CLASS FLARING IS LIKELY FROM REGIONS 5528 AND 5533. REGION 5528 PROVIDES A FAIR CHANCE FOR A MAJOR FLARE DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV BEGAN AT 18/1650Z. MAXIMUM FLUX OBSERVED THUS FAR WAS 18 PFU AT 18/1910Z. THIS PROTON EVENT PROBABLY ORIGINATED FROM YESTERDAY'S M8/2B FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS TOMORROW SUBSIDING TO MINOR STORM TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. THE STORMING IS EXPECTED IN RESPONSE TO THE MAJOR FLARE THAT OCCURRED AT 17/1614Z. THE SATELLITE PROTON EVENT MENTIONED ABOVE IS EXPECTED SLOWLY DECLINE DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 18/2100Z
sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5528 (N21W68) REMAINED IN A STATE OF GRADUAL DECAY, BUT CONTINUED AS A LARGE, COMPLEX SPOT GROUP. IT PRODUCED AN M2/0N FLARE AT 19/0556Z THAT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS ACROSS THE SPECTRUM. NEW REGION 5552 (S18E72) PRODUCED TWO M-CLASS FLARES AS IT ROTATED INTO VIEW. THE FIRST WAS AN M1/SN AT 18/2347Z AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK TYPE II SWEEP. THE SECOND WAS AN M3/1N AT 19/0748Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. REGION 5533 (S19W44) REMAINED IN A STATE OF GRADUAL DECAY AND WAS QUIET DURING THE PERIOD. NEW REGION 5553 (S24E30) EMERGED AS A SMALL UNIPOLAR GROUP.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 5528 AND 5552 ARE LIKELY TO CONTINUE PRODUCING M-CLASS FLARES. REGION 5528 RETAINS POTENTIAL FOR ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 18/2100Z TO 19/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV THAT BEGAN AT 18/1650Z REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 18 PARTICLE FLUX UNITS (PFU) AT 19/1910Z AND ENDED AT 18/2225Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE LEVELS WITH PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES. THIS ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO OCCUR IN RESPONSE TO RECENT MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. THE RECURRENT PATTERN ALSO SUPPORTS THIS FORECAST.
