sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5793 (S26W21) PRODUCED AN M7/3B FLARE AT 1647Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MODERATE DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. THE EVENT WAS MOST REMARKABLE IN ITS GRADUAL RISE AND FALL SIGNATURE, WITH A LONG DURATION THAT KEPT THE X-RAY FLUX ABOVE M-LEVEL FOR NEARLY FOUR HOURS FROM 1600-2000Z. THE REGION EXHIBITED SIGNIFICANT GROWTH DURING THE PERIOD AND HAS A FAIRLY COMPLICATED MAGNETIC STRUCTURE. THE REMAINDER OF THE FLARE ACTIVITY CONSISTED OF A FEW C-CLASS SUBFLARES. REGION 5786 (N12W78), SO IMPRESSIVE A FEW DAYS AGO, CONTINUED TO DECAY AND SIMPLIFY QUIETLY. SURGE ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED ON EAST LIMB AT N28. (NOTE: DUE TO THE M7 FLARE AND ASSOCIATED BURST ACTIVITY THE 1700Z 10.7CM FLUX MEASUREMENT WAS NOT AVAILABLE. AN ESTIMATE BASED ON THE 1400Z MEASUREMENT IS INCLUDED IN PART IV. BELOW.)

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. THE PRIMARY THREAT FOR ACTIVITY IS REGION 5793.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. THE GEOMAGNETIC STORM WHICH BEGAN AT 17/0925Z APPEARS TO HAVE ENDED AS OF 18/1200Z. DURING THE DISTURBANCE, MID- LATITUDES WERE AT MOSTLY MAJOR STORM LEVELS AND HIGH LAT- ITUDES WERE AT MOSTLY SEVERE STORM LEVELS. CONDITIONS SUBSIDED TO PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY. AN ENHANCEMENT WAS OBSERVED IN THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON FLUXES BEGINNING AT 18Z BUT EVENT LEVEL WAS NOT ATTAINED AS OF 2100Z. THE INCREASE WAS PROBABLY A RESULT OF TODAY'S M7 FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. THE ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TOMORROW AS A RESPONSE TO THE X1 FLARE OF 16 NOVEMBER, AND ON THE SECOND DAY AS A RESULT OF TODAY'S FLARE. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS BY THE THIRD DAY.

THE FIRST WAS AN X1/2B AT 20/2135Z ASSOCIATED WITH A 620 SFU TENFLARE AND SIGNIFICANT TYPES II AND IV RADIO SWEEPS. THE SECOND WAS AN X4/2B AT 21/1347Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A MAJOR TYPE II RADIO SWEEP. THE REGION DISPLAYED SIGNIFICANT DECAY AS ITS MAIN PENUMBRAL MASS SPLIT INTO THREE SEGMENTS. THE MAGNETIC STRUCTURE OF THE REGION APPEARED TO SIMPLIFY AS WELL. REGION 5796 (N13E08) DISPLAYED SIGNIFICANT GROWTH DURING THE PERIOD, BUT REMAINED QUIET. NEW REGIONS 5802 (S12E14), 5803 (S12E46), 5804 (N44E64), AND 5805 (S11E69) WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. AN X1/2N FLARE OCCURRED IN REGION 5800 (N13W08) AT 25/2355Z. NOTED WITH THIS EVENT WAS A 610 SFU TENFLARE, SIGNIFICANT TYPE 4 SWEEP, AND LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM. AN M4/2B FLARE OCCURRED AT 1941Z FROM REGION 5800 AGAIN WITH A TYPE 4 SWEEP AND 430 SFU TENFLARE. THIS REGION CONTINUES TO DISPLAY GROWTH IN ITS TRAILING SPOT STRUCTURE AND IS COMPLEX MAGNETICALLY. REGION 5808 (S07W20) CONTINUES ITS RAPID GROWTH. THIS REGION IS ALSO BECOMING MORE COMPLEX AND HAS EXHIBITED OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES. ISOLATED SUBFLARES HAVE ALSO BEEN NOTED IN REGIONS 5806 (N19E41) AND 5804 (N43E06) TO A LESSER EXTENT. NEW REGION 5809 (S18E67) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 5800 WITH ITS COMPLEX MAGNETIC STRUCTURE AS NOTED BY ITS KINKED INVERSION LINE ALONG WITH ITS CONTINUED GROWTH IN ITS SPOTS STRUCTURE SHOULD CONTINUE TO PRODUCE OCCASIONAL M-CLASS EVENTS WITH THE POTENTIAL THERE FOR ISOLATED X-CLASS ACTIVITY AND PROTONS. REGION 5808 ALSO SHOWS PROMISE FOR INCREASED FLARE ACTIVITY AS IT CONTINUES TO MATURE.

sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5799 (N21W68) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS EVENT: AN M1/1B FLARE AT 1739Z. THE REST OF THE DAY WAS CHARACTERIZED BY OCCASIONAL C-CLASS SUBFLARES FROM A NUMBER OF DIFFERENT REGIONS. REGION 5808 (S05W34) SLOWED DOWN FROM ITS INITIAL RAPID GROWTH PHASE AND IS NOW THE LARGEST REGION ON THE DISK. BOTH REGION 5808 AND 5800 (N26W20) SHOW SOME MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY.

sections.text: MODERATE. REGIONS 5800 AND 5808 SHOW THE MOST PROMISE FOR PRODUCING M-CLASS OR BETTER FLARES. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A CHANCE FOR MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY FROM THESE TWO REGIONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 26/2100Z TO 27/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED. AN ENHANCEMENT IN THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PARTICLES BEGAN AROUND 1200UT AND ATTAINED EVENT LEVEL AT 2000UT. THE MAXIMUM FLUX OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD WAS 14 PFU AT GREATER THAN 10MEV AT 2005Z. NOTE: A SUDDEN IMPULSE OCCURRED AFTER THE PERIOD'S END AT 2141UT. THE IMPULSE MEASURED ALMOST 40 GAMMA IN BOULDER. A JUMP IN THE GREATER THAN 10MEV PARTICLES OCCURRED AT THE SAME TIME, RAISING LEVELS TO 49 PFU AT 2140Z. THE PARTICLE ENHANCEMENT AND THE SHOCK ARE MOST LIKELY ASSOCIATED WITH THE LONG DURATION M4/2B FLARE THAT OCCURRED ON THE 26TH.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE CONTINUES. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5800 (N26W20) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S LARGEST FLARE: A C8/1N AT 1025Z. THIS GROUP IS UNDERGOING STEADY DECAY AND SIMPLIFICATION AND DID NOT PRODUCE ANY OTHER FLARES. ADDITIONAL SUBFLARES WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD: MOST OF THESE WERE FROM REGION 5809 (S18E44), A SMALL E-TYPE GROUP WHICH IS SHOWING A SLIGHT GROWTH TREND. A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP WAS REPORTED AT 27/2348Z. NO OPTICAL ASSOCIATIONS COULD BE CONFIDENTLY MADE, BUT A 15 DEGREE FILAMENT NEAR N35E15 DID DISAPPEAR SOMETIME BETWEEN 27/1614Z AND 28/1553Z AND MIGHT HAVE BEEN RELATED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. THE MOST PROBABLE SOURCES FOR M-CLASS EVENTS ARE REGIONS 5800 AND 5809.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY ACTIVE. A SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS OBSERVED AT 27/2141Z AND MEASURED ABOUT 40 GAMMA IN BOUL- DER. THE DISTURBANCE CONTINUES IN PROGRESS AT THIS TIME. THE PROTON EVENT WHICH BEGAN AT 27/2000Z INCREASED MARKEDLY AT THE TIME OF THE SHOCK AND ATTAINED A MAXIMUM FLUX OF 380 PFU AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV AT 28/1105Z. THE FLUX LEVELS ARE DECLINING AT THIS TIME AS THE EVENT CONTINUES IN PROGRESS. AFTER CLOSER EXAMINATION, IT APPEARS THAT THIS SHOCK IS MORE LIKELY TO HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY THE X1/2N FLARE OF 25/2355Z NOV RATHER THAN THE M4/2B FLARE AS WAS STATED YESTERDAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AT ACTIVE LEVELS TOMORROW AS EFFECTS FROM THE M4/2B FLARE OF 26 NOVEMBER ARRIVE. CONDITIONS SHOULD SUB- SIDE TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS BY THE SECOND  DAY AND SHOULD BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5809 (S18E31) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S LARGEST EVENT: A C9/1F AT 1816Z. THE GROUP CON- TINUED TO GROW SLOWLY TODAY BUT REMAINS SMALL AND ONLY PRODUCED A COUPLE OF ADDITIONAL SUBFLARES. REGION 5800 (N26W46) CONTINUED TO SLOWLY DECAY AND PRODUCED A FEW SUBFLARES. A TOTAL OF 5 NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: 4 OF THESE ARE NEWLY EMERGED AND ONE ROTATED INTO VIEW FROM THE EAST LIMB AT N13. THESE REGIONS AS WELL AS THE REMAINING REGIONS ON THE DISK WERE STABLE AND QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW, BUT WITH A CONTINUED CHANCE FOR MODERATE LEVELS. REGIONS 5809, 5800, AND 5808 (S05W62) APPEAR TO BE MAIN GROUPS ON THE DISK WITH FLARE POTENTIAL. OLD REGION 5783 (N18, L-299) WHICH PRODUCED SEVERAL M-CLASS AND ONE X-CLASS FLARE ON ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT IS DUE TO RETURN TOMORROW AND MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO SOLAR ACTIVITY WHEN IT APPEARS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 28/2100Z TO 29/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED WITH A FEW ACTIVE PERIODS. THE DISTURBANCE WHICH BEGAN AT 27/2141Z APPEARS TO BE GRADUALLY SUBSIDING. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT WHICH BEGAN AT 27/2000Z ENDED AT 29/1555Z. THE PEAK FLUX WAS 380 PFU AT 28/1105Z. A FORBUSH DECREASE BEGAN AT ABOUT 28/10Z, AND ATTAINED A MAXIMUM DEPRESSION OF ABOUT 14% NEAR 29/07Z. THE LEVELS ARE RECOVERING BUT CONTINUE TO BE DEPRESSED AT THIS TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO OCCASIONALLY ACTIVE TOMORROW AND IS EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5800 (N26W59) PRO- DUCED AN X2/3B FLARE AT 1229Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH FLARE LOOPS AND MODERATE DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. THE EVENT WAS OF LONG DURATION: THE TIME FROM START TO HALF POWER WAS 68 MINUTES AND X-RAY EMISSION WAS ABOVE THE M-LEVEL FROM ABOUT 12-16Z. THE RE- MAINDER OF ACTIVITY CONSISTED OF A FEW LOW LEVEL C-CLASS SUB- FLARES.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY MODERATE, BUT WITH A CHANCE FOR HIGH LEVELS. THE PRIN- CIPAL THREATS FOR MAJOR ACTIVITY APPEAR TO BE 5800 (PERSIS- TENCE), AND REGION 5806 (N18W18) WHICH HAS RECENTLY DEVELOPED A DELTA CONFIGURATION. REGION 5811 (S16E41), A RELATIVELY SMALL GROUP, APPEARED TO BE DEVELOPING A DELTA DURING THE PERIOD AND MIGHT ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO MODERATE LEVELS OF ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LAT- ITUDES. HIGH LATITUDES WERE AT MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS WITH OC- CASIONAL MINOR STORM PERIODS. A GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 30/1345Z IN RESPONSE TO TODAY'S X3/3B FLARE. THE HIGHEST FLUX AT GREATER THAN 10MEV SO FAR WAS 570 PFU AT 30/2100Z, BUT THE LEVELS WERE STILL CLIMBING AT THE END OF THE PERIOD. A PCA EVENT BEGAN AT 1825Z AND CONTINUES IN PROGRESS. THE FORBUSH DECREASE WHICH BEGAN AT 28/10Z APPEARED TO END AROUND 30/06Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ON THE THIRD DAY IN RESPONSE TO TODAY'S X2/3B FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN M2 FLARE OCCURRED AT 30/2306Z BUT WAS NOT OBSERVED OPTICALLY. SEVERAL UPPER LEVEL C-CLASS FLARES OCCURRED DURING THE LATTER PART OF THE PERIOD: A C9/SF FROM 5800 (N26W71) AT 1807Z, A C8/SF FROM 5800 AT 1858Z, AND A C8/2N FROM 5806 (N19W30) AT 1932Z. REGION 5806 APPEARS TO HAVE LOST ITS DELTA CONFIGURATION. SURGING WAS OBSERVED ON EAST LIMB NEAR N20, HINTING AT ADDITIONAL NEW REGIONS WHICH MAY SOON ROTATE INTO VIEW.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGIONS 5800 AND 5806 CONTINUE TO BE THE PRIMARY THREATS FOR SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY. REGION 5800 WILL BE ROTATING OFF THE SOLAR DISK SOMETIME ON THE SECOND DAY WHICH WILL LOWER ACTIVITY AND BACKGROUND LEVELS SOMEWHAT. NEW REGIONS ROTATING INTO VIEW MAY PROVIDE PARTIAL COMPENSATION FOR THE DECREASE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS PREVAILED FROM THE START OF THE PERIOD UNTIL 1750Z WHEN A NEGATIVE SUDDEN STORM COM- MENCEMENT WAS OBSERVED. SHORTLY AFTER THE COMMENCEMENT, BOTH GOES-6 AND GOES-7 OBSERVED MAGNETOPAUSE CROSSINGS, A CON- DITION WHICH PERSISTED UNTIL ABOUT 2000Z. GEOMAGNETIC CON- DITIONS HAVE BEEN AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS AT MID- LATITUDES AND MAJOR TO SEVERE LEVELS AT THE HIGHER LATITUDES. THIS IMPULSE WAS PROBABLY FROM THE X2/3B FLARE OF 30 NOVEMBER. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT CONTINUES. THE PEAK FLUX OF GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTONS SO FAR WAS 7300 PFU AT 01/1340Z. LEVELS APPEAR TO BE DECLINING AT THIS TIME. THE PCA EVENT WHICH BEGAN AT 30/1825Z WAS IN PROGRESS ALL DAY WITH ABSORPION UP TO ABOUT 7 DB AT 01/1730Z. FIRST INDICATIONS OF A FORBUSH DECREASE WERE OBSERVED AT ABOUT 01/2000Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 12 HOURS. CONDITIONS SHOULD GRADUALLY DIMINISH TO MINOR STORM FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FIRST DAY, AND MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS ON THE SECOND DAY. UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS ARE EXPECTED BY DAY 3.

sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  ONLY C-CLASS X-RAY FLARES HAVE BEEN OBSERVED SINCE YESTERDAY.  REGION 5800 (N26W84) REMAINS RELATIVELY QUIET AS IT APPROACHES THE WEST LIMB.  REGION 5806 (N20W43) RETAINS SOME COMPLEXITY BUT HAS NOT BEEN PARTICULARLY ACTIVE.  NEW REGION 5821 (N19E70) APPEARS TO BE A FAIRLY LARGE SUNSPOT GROUP OF MODERATE COMPLEXITY.  THE FOLLOWING SMALL NEW REGIONS WERE ALSO NUMBERED - 5822 (S10W16), 5823 (S10E24), AND 5824 (S07E32).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  ENERGETIC ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 5800, 5806, AND 5821.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 01/2100Z TO 02/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO ACTIVE.  A MINOR GEOMAGNETIC STORM, WHICH WAS IN PROGRESS YESTERDAY, HAS ENDED.  THE FIELD AT MIDDLE LATITUDES HAS BEEN AT QUIET LEVELS SINCE 02/1200Z. A SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV REMAINS IN PROGRESS - START 30/1345Z, AND MAXIMUM (7300 PFU) AT 01/1340Z. THE FLUX HAS BEEN NEAR THE 10 MEV EVENT THRESHOLD OF 10 PFU SINCE ABOUT 02/1630Z.  THE PCA EVENT APPEARS TO HAVE ENDED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV IS EXPECTED TO END WITHIN THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5837 (N20E08) PRODUCED AN M3/2B FLARE WITH ASSOCIATED TYPE II SWEEP AT 18/2342Z. THIS REGION HAS GROWN SINCE THE EVENT BOTH IN SPOT STRUCTURE AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. SEVERAL LOW LEVEL C-CLASS SUBFLARES HAVE ALSO BEEN ATTRIBUTED TO THIS REGION. REGIONS 5844 (S10W66), 5846 (N19E28), AND 5847 (N34W69) CONTINUED TO PRODUCE OCCASIONAL C-CLASS ACTIVITY. NUMEROUS UNCORRELATED TYPE III SWEEPS AND BURST BETWEEN 245-610MHZ HAVE BEEN NOTED THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD INDICATING THE POSSIBLE RETURN OF REGION 5806 (N18 CARRINGTON 034) OR ANOTHER SIGNIFICANT REGION. REGIONS 5848 (N26E68) AND 5849 (S08E74) WERE NUMBERED TODAY.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE WITH MOSTLY C-CLASS ACTIVITY EXPECTED FROM THE AFFOREMENTIONED REGIONS. REGION 5836 (N13W13) HAS REMAINED QUIET THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD HOWEVER IT HAS GROWN IN MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY TO A BETA-GAMMA REGION AGAIN AND MAY CONTRIBUTE TO ACTIVITY LEVELS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. TODAY'S ACTIVITY WAS CHAR- ACTERIZED BY OCCASIONAL C-CLASS SUBFLARES. A MARKED RISE IN X-RAY BACKGROUND LEVELS WAS NOTED AT ABOUT 16Z, AND APPEARS TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF SEVERAL NEW SUNSPOT GROUPS. A TOTAL OF SEVEN NEW REGION ASSIGNMENTS WERE MADE TODAY, WITH THREE OF THE NEW REGIONS EMERGING ON THE DISK AND FOUR OF THEM ROTATING INTO VIEW. AMONG THESE, REGIONS 5853 (S10E70), 5854 (N23E78) AND 5857 (S15E80) SHOW SOME MATURE SPOTS. REGION 5854 IN PARTICULAR SEEMS TO BE FAIRLY DYNAMIC AS IT CONTINUED TO SHOW SURGE ACTIVITY ON THE LIMB THROUGHOUT THE DAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE MAIN REGIONS THAT APPEAR TO BE CAPABLE OF M-CLASS FLARES ARE 5837 (N19W30), WHICH SHOWS SOME MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY, AND 5854. THE INCREASE OF BACKGROUND LEVELS AND NEW FLUX EMERGENCE ALSO SUGGESTS A GENERAL UPWARD TREND IN SOLAR ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 21/2100Z TO 22/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO STORM LEVELS DURING THE PERIOD. QUIET TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS PREDOMINATED UNTIL ABOUT 12Z WHEN DISTURBED CONDITIONS BEGAN. SINCE THEN MIDDLE LATITUDES HAVE BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AND THE HIGHER LATITUDES HAVE BEEN AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE OF THE DISTURBANCE APPEARS TO BE A FAVORABLY LOCATED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. ISOLATED PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS MAY PERSIST EARLY ON THE FIRST DAY AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE SUBSIDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5854 (N23E65) PRO- DUCED AN M5/SF FLARE AT 22/2308Z. THE EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY LOOPS AND MODEST RADIO BURSTS AT THE HIGHER FREQUENCIES (2695- 15400 MHZ). REGION 5854 IS NOW THE LARGEST SUNSPOT GROUP ON THE SOLAR DISK (590 MILLIONTHS). ADDITIONAL M-CLASS EVENTS OCCURRED WITHOUT OPTICAL ASSOCIATIONS AT 0125Z, 0144Z, AND 0219Z, DURING A PERIOD OF GENERALLY ENHANCED X-RAY FLUX LEVELS FROM 0130- 0230UT. THE REST OF THE DAY WAS CHARACTERIZED BY UPPER LEVEL C-CLASS FLARES MOSTLY FROM 5854 BUT ALSO FROM 5853 (S09E61). THERE ARE SOME ADDITIONAL SPOTS ROTATING INTO VIEW TO THE EAST OF 5853, BUT PROXIMITY TO LIMB PREVENTED ATTEMPTS TO DISTINGUISH A SEPARATE REGION AT THIS TIME.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5854 IS CONSIDERED TO BE THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR M-CLASS EVENTS. IN ADDITION, THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY FROM REGION 5854.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED, WITH A PERIOD OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS FROM ABOUT 0300-1200Z. THE DIS- TURBED PERIOD APPEARS TO BE RESIDUAL FROM YESTERDAY'S ACTIVE TO STORM LEVEL ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE DUE TO TODAY'S ONLY M- CLASS EVENT: AN M1/1F FROM REGION 5850 (S29W48) AT 1338Z. THIS REGION DISPLAYED ENHANCED PLAGE AND PRODUCED ADDITIONAL SUB- FLARES DURING THE DAY AS IT APPEARED TO BE UNDERGOING SLOW GROWTH. REGION 5854 (N24E54) CONTINUES TO BE THE LARGEST MOST COMPLICATED GROUP ON THE DISK WITH AN AREA OF ABOUT 1110 MIL- LIONTHS, BUT PRODUCED ONLY A COUPLE OF SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 5853 (S10E50) ALSO CONTRIBUTED SOME SUBFLARES. CURRENT OBSERVATIONS SHOW THIS TO BE AN ELONGATED F-TYPE BETA- GAMMA GROUP. SURGE ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED ON EAST LIMB AT N10 AND S24. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK WAS ESSENTIALLY QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR HIGH LEVELS. THE MAIN THREATS FOR ACTIVITY ARE REGIONS 5854 AND 5853.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 23/2100Z TO 24/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY QUIET UNTIL SHORTLY AFTER 0900Z WHEN ACTIVITY BECAME UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE AT MIDDLE LATITUDES, AND MOSTLY ACTIVE WITH SOME STORM PERIODS AT HIGHER LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED WITH OCCASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. A GRADUAL INCREASE IS POSSIBLE LATE ON THE THIRD DAY AS A RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE SHOULD BE FAVOR- ABLY POSITIONED AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5852 (S25E19) PRODUCED TODAY'S LARGEST FLARE: AN M3/1N AT 2028Z. AN ADDITIONAL M-FLARE WAS PRODUCED BY THIS REGION: AN M1/1N AT 1644Z. BOTH EVENTS WERE ACCOMPANIED BY MODEST RADIO BURST ACTIVITY. THIS REGION EXHIBITED RAPID GROWTH DURING THE PERIOD AND APPEARS TO HAVE FORMED A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION. AN ADDITIONAL M- FLARE OCCURRED DURING THE PERIOD: AN M2/2F FROM 5853 (S09E37) AT 0039Z. THE REMAINDER OF ACTIVITY CONSISTED OF NUMEROUS SUB- FLARES AT THE UPPER C-CLASS LEVEL FROM SEVERAL REGIONS: MOST NOTABLY REGIONS 5854 (N24E42) AND 5850 (S28W60). A LARGE 20 DEGREE FILAMENT DISAPPEARED NEAR S30E25 SOMETIME BETWEEN 24/ 1552Z AND 25/1500Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE WITH A CHANCE FOR HIGH LEVELS. THE PREDOMINANT REGIONS ARE RAPIDLY GROWING 5852, REGION 5854 (STILL THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK), AND REGION 5853 WHICH CONTINUES TO HAVE SOME MAG- NETIC COMPLEXITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 24/2100Z TO 25/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED WITH A FEW BRIEF, ISOLATED ACTIVE PERIODS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED TOMORROW, BECOMING UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE ON THE SECOND DAY, AND PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE WITH SOME ISOLATED MINOR STORMING ON THE THIRD DAY. THE INCREASE IS FORE- CAST BECAUSE OF THE COMBINED POSSIBILITIES OF EFFECTS FROM A RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE, AND TODAY'S FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5852 (S26E05) PRO- DUCED TWO MAJOR FLARES: AN M5/1N AT 0538Z ACCOMPANIED BY FAIRLY STRONG RADIO BURSTS, AND AN M6/1B AT 1815Z ACCOMPANIED BY MODEST RADIO BURSTS. THIS REGION CONTINUED TO GROW DURING THE PERIOD AND POSSESSES A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION. AN ADDITIONAL M- CLASS EVENT WAS PRODUCED BY THE LARGEST REGION 5854 (N24E28): AN M2/1F AT 0750Z. THE REST OF THE ACTIVITY WAS CHARACTERIZED BY FREQUENT SUBFLARES FROM A VARIETY OF REGIONS, PRIMARILY 5852 AND 5854.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. THE EVOLUTION OF 5852 APPEARS TO BE ESPECIALLY FAVORABLE FOR DEVELOPMENT OF MAGNETIC FIELD SHEARING AND CONTINUED MAJOR FLARE PRODUCTION. REGION 5854 ALSO HAS POTENTIAL FOR LARGE FLARES IF THE RIGHT TRIGGER MECHANISM MATERIALIZES. REGION 5853 (N09E26) CONTINUES TO POSE SOMEWHAT OF A FLARE THREAT FOR AT LEAST M-CLASS EVENTS AS IT MAINTAINS SOME MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 25/2100Z TO 26/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET UNTIL SHORTLY AFTER 0900Z WHEN CONDITIONS BECAME UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. MINOR STORMING WAS OBSERVED LATE IN THE PERIOD, BEGINNING ABOUT 1400Z AT HIGH LATITUDES AND AT ABOUT 1930Z AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. ALTHOUGH THERE IS SOME UNCERTAINTY, THIS INCREASE APPEARS TO BE THE BEGINNING OF RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS WHICH HAVE BEEN MENTIONED IN PREVIOUS FORECASTS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS, WITH SOME PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING, ESPECIALLY ON THE SECOND DAY. THE CURRENT ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AS THE CORONAL HOLE SHOULD CONTINUE TO BE IN A FAVORABLE POSITION OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. EFFECTS FROM YESTERDAY'S DISAPPEARING FILAMENT AND FROM TODAY'S LONG DURATION M5 EVENT MIGHT COMBINE TO GIVE THE ADDITIONAL ENHANCEMENT ON THE SECOND DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  REGION 5852 (S26W07) CONTINUED TO DEVELOP IN COMPLEXITY AND NOW APPEARS TO BE REACHING MATURITY.  THIS REGION PRODUCED TWO M-CLASS FLARES DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS, AN M1/SF AT 27/0141Z AND A LONG DURATION M3/SN AT 27/1352Z.  REGION 5854 (N24E14) REMAINS A LARGE SUNSPOT GROUP BUT HAS BEEN RELATIVELY VOID OF ACTIVITY FOR THE PAST DAY.  NEW REGIONS 5861 (S23W28) AND 5862 (N17E78) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  A MAJOR FLARE IS EXPECTED IN REGION 5852. REGIONS 5853 (S10E18) AND 5854 MAY PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 26/2100Z TO 27/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO STORM LEVELS.  THE SOURCE OF THIS ACTIVITY IS BELIEVED TO BE A FAVORABLY LOCATED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR STORM TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.  SEVERAL SOURCES MAY CONTRIBUTE TO THE EXPECTED LEVELS OF ACTIVITY INCLUDING CORONAL HOLE, DISAPPEARING FILAMENT, AND LONG DURATION X-RAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  REGION 5852 (S25W20) PRODUCED THE LARGEST FLARE OF THE PAST DAY, AN M9/2B AT 28/0329Z.  THIS REGION HAS SHOWN SIGNS OF WEAKENING SINCE THIS MAJOR FLARE.  REGIONS 5853 (S09E05) AND 5854 (N23E01) EACH PRODUCED LOW LEVEL M-CLASS ACTIVITY, AN M1/1N AT 27/2204Z AND AN M1/SF AT 28/1008Z, RESPECTIVELY.  REGION 5863 (N20W13) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  ANOTHER MAJOR FLARE IS POSSIBLE IN REGION 5852.  REGIONS 5853 AND 5854 MAY PRODUCE ADDITIONAL M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED.  YESTERDAY'S DISTURBANCE HAS ENDED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  REGION 5852 (S26W32) PRODUCED THE LARGEST FLARE OF THE DAY, AN M9/1F AT 29/1826Z. THIS REGION HAS AGAIN ENTERED A GROWTH PHASE, INCREASING BOTH SUNSPOT AREA AND NUMBER.  MAGNETICALLY THIS REGION REMAINS QUITE COMPLEX.  ANOTHER MAJOR FLARE, AN M8 AT 29/1105Z, WAS NOT CORRELATED TO AN OPTICAL FLARE.  REGION 5858 (S18E13) IS GROWING RAPIDLY AND HAS PRODUCED SEVERAL FLARES.  THE LARGEST WAS AN M4/1B AT 28/2115Z.  NEW REGION 5864 (N12E69) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  ADDITIONAL MAJOR FLARES ARE EXPECTED IN REGION 5852.  M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE IN REGIONS 5853 (S09W07), 5854 (N23W12), AND 5858.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 28/2100Z TO 29/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS.  AN SSC WAS OBSERVED AT MIDDLE LATITUDE STATIONS (20 NT AT BOULDER) AT 29/0654Z.  THE SOURCE OF THIS DISTURBANCE IS MOST LIKLEY FLARE RELATED, HOWEVER, BECAUSE OF THE AMOUNT OF SOLAR ACTIVITY IN THE PAST FEW DAYS THE EXACT EVENT IS UNKNOWN.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.  THE PRESENT DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE WITHIN THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  REGION 5858 (S18E01) WAS THE MOST ACTIVE SUNSPOT GROUP THIS PAST DAY, PRODUCING AN M5/1N AT 30/0208Z AND AN X1/1N AT 30/0419Z.  THIS REGION RETAINS SOME MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY ALTHOUGH THE SUNSPOT STRUCTURE HAS SIMPLIFIED SINCE THESE TWO MAJOR FLARES.  REGION 5852 (S26W44) IS THE LARGEST SUNSPOT GROUP ON THE DISK BUT GENERATED ONLY ONE LOW LEVEL M-FLARE SINCE YESTERDAY, AN M2/SF AT 29/2322Z.  THIS REGION HAS ALSO HAD SOME WHITE LIGHT DECAY BUT STILL REMAINS LARGE AND COMPLEX.  NEW REGION 5865 (S37E72) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  REGIONS 5852 AND 5858 MAY PRODUCE MAJOR FLARES.  M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE IN REGION 5854 (N23W27).

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM. THE MIDDLE LATITUDE FIELD HAS BEEN BELOW STORM LEVEL SINCE 30/0000Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS AS YESTERDAY'S DISTURBANCE ENDS.  THE REMAINING TWO DAYS SHOULD BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  REGION 5852 (S27W57) KEPT ACTIVITY AT HIGH LEVELS BY PRODUCING AN X2/2B AT 31/0944Z. THIS REGION CONTINUES TO EXHIBIT OVERALL SIMPLIFICATION IN WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA STRUCTURE.  REGION 5858 (S19W13) ALSO CONTINUES TO DECAY AND HAS PRODUCED ONLY SUBFLARES SINCE YESTERDAY.  NEW REGION 5866 (N15W08) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE IS POSSIBLE IN REGION 5852 OR 5858.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 31/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO STORM LEVELS. THE MAJOR GEOMAGNETIC STORM ENDED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AT 30/0000Z.  THE MIDDLE LATITUDE FIELD FOLLOWING THE END OF THE STORM WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.  THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY ACTIVE WITH STORM CONDITIONS EXPERIENCED FROM 31/0300 TO 31/1800Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS AND UNSETTLED TO QUIET BY THE THIRD DAY OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.
